text: Bottle from Beers of the World. Pours black with thick tan head. Aroma of coffee and roasted malts.

Bottle from Beers of the World in Rochester, NY. Pours black like used motor oil, completely opaque, huge light brown head that stays long; sparse lacing. Nose is roasted malt and chocolate with yeast and nut notes; a hint of ash. Taste is quite well balanced with sweet maltiness and nice dark chocolate bitterness. Medium bodied brew with a rich, creamy mouthfeel. Excellent porter.

Black beer with thick brown head stays. Aroma is firstly chocolate, then comes fruits, bread and little hops. Taste is balanced with medium sweet and bitter. Nice mild hoppy finish. Medium body. Nice and pleasure to drink this one.

Originally rated on 1/14/2009. Black body with a thick dark tan cap that left plenty of lace. Aromas and flavors of licorice, dark fruit, toasted malts and a little coffee. I deducted a little because there was a very slight metallic presence. Overall it was a pretty good porter, that i wouldnt mind trying again

Botella for @VastActiv, Euro Trade 04/05/17. 
Color negro opaco corona de espuma beige, aromas intensos a avena, seguidos de notas tostadas con un fondo dulce, el sabor es tostado con buenas notas a regaliz, sabor agradable cuerpo sedoso

This is the standard for a porter: its sturdy black colour, the smell of roasted malt and the rich mouth filling taste of chocolate, a hint of coffee and the roasted malt... simply put, this is the best porter, if not beer, in the world that all other porters are (or should be!) compared to.

33 cl bottle, BBE 23/11/2018. Probably my most often drank beer of the last couple of years. Smooth black beer with a nice beige head. Sweet chocolate aromas with roasty, smooth coffee, some ripe dark fruit. Taste of chocolate and coffee with a roasty, hoppy finish. Gets quite dry(ing) towards the end. The medium- body is a mixed bag; drinkability is high, but sometimes one yearns for more. Great beer.

Bottle from 2015. Black, beige head. Aroma is dark fruit, raisins, chocolate, coffee, bread, leathery. Medium sweetness with light/medium bitterness. Medium body, thin creamy texture with a pretty lively carbonation. A porter that draws to the dark fruit area, kinda like it.

For the book! Aroma is malty, coffee, roasted malt, bready, sweet but nice. Appearance is dark dark brown, light tan head, poured thickish. Taste is roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, bready, a little astringent, bready, somewhat disappointing. Mouthfeel is medium body, light carbonation, astringent roasted malt aftertaste. Overall, this one just misses the mark.

Its good beer in the porter genre. A bit mämmi-ish and home beer -like though, so it doesnt taste like a "world-class" beer should. But some may find this a plus, rather than a minus.

Aroma is strong, dark and rich.
The taste is also very burnt and rich. Chocolate, coffee, raisins, all sorts of "black" things.

Good is that theres not too much bitterness. The beer might even be a bit too sweet, but this might be a matter of taste.

The carbonation feels a bit sloppy, but fits to the style.

A very "standard" porter Id say. A good "reference standard" beer in this genre.

UPDATED: FEB 1, 2017 Pours a dark black with a tan head and nice lacing. Aroma of malt and a hint of chocolate. Taste is not as exciting as Id hoped. I love Porters and this one is good but not as good as others I love. Although a good Porter I wouldnt drink it again because I now of a lot better Porters out there.

2009 vintage... Pours a black color with loads of beige lacing and head. Smells like a chocolate factory, really nice! Chalky palate... Never rate palate... This is a must. Chocolate and coffee flavor a nice porter.

12 oz. bottle, pours black with a medium tan / light brown head. Aroma brings out roasted malt upfront, followed by cocoa powder and a little chalky notes. Flavour is robust, with dry cocoa powder, toasted malt, and a little coal. Robust and smooth on the palate. Lots of depth. A pleasure to drink. Excellent.
Bottle. Black with a tan head. Aroma of roasted malt and cocoa. The flavor also had a coffee taste. It was bittersweet.

$3.99 bottle from Wine Warehouse. Pours THICK and extremely dark, nearly black with a frothy, soft medium brown head. Aroma of dark chocolates, smoke, caramel. Taste is smoked deli meat, caramel, dark fruit, chocolate, coffee, ash, molasses... pretty complex and pretty delicious.

UPDATED: DEC 8, 2016 Aromat: Nuty palone, można pokusić się o stwierdzenie, że wręcz wędzone. Aczkolwiek nie jest to bardzo wyraźne odczucie.
Wygląd: Czarne, z drobną pianą.
Smak: Pierwszą rzeczą jaką możemy odczuć jest wysoka paloność i idące z nimi w parze nuty owocowe, nawiasem mówiąc dość subtelne. Goryczka jest analogiczna do wyżej opisanych odczuć. Ogółem, największymi mankamentami tego piwa sa jego jednowymiarowość, brak ciała i spora wodnistość, co sprawia, że piwo daje wrażenie trywialnego, przeciętnego przedstawiciela stylu.

Bottle at pub. Pours dark brown with light brown head. Aroma is coffee and chocolate with malts. Taste is really roasted almost smoky. Hints of tar and cocoa in the flavor. This beer hides the 7.2 ABV really well. Palate is quite slick considering beers strong flavours. Surprisingly nice baltic porter, will drink again.
Color is dark brown, with creamy brown head. Aroma is roast, coffee, toffee. Taste is nice m mixture of roast and coffee and sweetness. Very good porter.
Black with thick beige head. Aroma has light caramel and roasted malt. Very discrete hint of smoke perhaps. Caramel, roast and licorice flavour. Nicely balanced with the ABV just barely noticeable.

Bottle @ White Terror or Northern Alliance against the Bolsheviks, Sønderborg. Pours cloudy very dark brown with stable tan head. Clear aroma of malt, with notes of fruit, coffee and vanilla and touches of yeast. Bitter, roasty taste with notes of coffee and malt and touches of hops and barrel. Roasty and coffeelike aftertaste. Good.

Bottle 330 ml. Dark brown color with tan foam. Aroma: rich malty, wine, sweet caramel, dried fruits, dried dates and figs. Taste: complex, honey, caramel, port wine, roasted, dried prunes, slightly burnt, raisins, dry burnt and hop finish, warming. Very good.

0,33l bottle at home. Pours black colour with moderately large amount of smooth head. Aroma has burned, dark malts, syrup, brown sugar, caramel, some bitterness. Medium body, noticeable sweetness and bitterness.

Bottle from Euroswap by rosenbergh, thanks a lot! Black color with tan head. Aroma is milk chocolate, some bottom fermenting yeasts, nutty, ashes. Taste is chocolate, molasses, more nuts and ashes, slight bitterness in the back. Rather light-bodied but still rich, and easily drinkable. Ticklish carbonation. Good Baltic Porter!
Aroma of strong coffee and malt. Deep black with creamy tan head. Coffee, raisins, and malt in the mouth. Full bodied but not lingering. Very good.

330ml bottle from Finland, drunk at home. Pours dark, with tan head. Aroma is chocolate and quite sweet. Body is fairly light with sweet caramel, molasses, dark malts, some bitter nutty roast. Good porter.
Probs the best porter Ive sampled so far. Not too extreme on the chocolate or the smoke. Really rounded, and nice after taste!

Bottle @ Peculier Pub. Inky black with large chocolate colored foamy head, cherry-mocha aroma, low carbonation, slightly sweet mocha taste with a hint of sour cherry, somewhat thick body, longish mocha finish. Nice porter, more like a stout.

Chocolate (not too much), burnt bread, head quickly disappears, nice dark color, almost not transparent, a pleasant bitter taste, not staying too long as an aftertaste (not fan of every bitter, so this one is good), medium complexity, some sweet taste, so not dry. Well balanced. I would drink it again.

Bottle at home. Black with surprisingly dark head, like chocolate mousse. Light coffee and cocoa, dried berries, typical soft nutty Baltic porter notes, slight dust and ash, slick olive oil, old coffee candies. Under medium sweet and bitter. Over medium bodied with slick feel and under medium carbonation. Quite nice.

Shared 11.2 oz. bottle. As Sinebrychoff Porter IV. Pours almost black with a foamy chocolate colored head. Heavy lacing. Aroma of dark malts and caramel with dark fruit notes. Taste: malt is prominent, with plenty of the traditional roast, chocolate, and coffee flavors. Medium-bodied. Good.

Aroma: extreme maltiness; Appearance: pitch black with billowy tan head that sticks around; Taste: starts out strongly malty but quickly turns into a bitter or almost smoky finish immediately afterwards. Palate: heavy bodied with bitter finish. Overall: I think the quality is good, but not my favorite style.
Black color with beige layer. Light fruity, dusty and ashes in the nose. Round dusty and coffeeish touch. Nice porter with light roasty aftertaste.
Black color. Thin , beige head . Aroma of roasted malt and chocolate . Rich ,sweet taste with notes of chocolate and coffee. Full , creamy body . Mild , roasted bitterness at the end. Decent porter.

W aromacie przede wszystkim nuty utlenieniowe, rodzynki, suszone owoce, nieco ciemnej czekolady, trochę karmelu, solidnia, aczkolwiek niezbyt intensywnie. W smaku mała pełnia, ciemna czekolada i rodzynki, do tego niezbyt przyjemna nuta żelazista kołacząca się gdzieś po podniebieniu. Casus porteru żywickiego, niezłe, łatwo dostępne piwo z masą ocen - a rzeczywistość smutniejsza niż statystyki. Thanks @rosembergh!

Black color with fluffy brown head. Aroma is roasted malt, caramel, hops and chocolate. Taste is coffee, chocolate and malts. Finish is very malty. Medium body and creamy mouthfeel with average carbonation.

12oz bottle. Black in color with a large lasting tan head. Big and rich aroma - rich dark chocolate, molasses, espresso, and anise. Very complex. The flavor starts with chocolatey sweetness and ends with bitter hops. Deep anise flavor. Just the slightest acrid note detracts, but otherwise it is excellent. The mouthfeel is big and thick, quite slick. Great beer overall.
Timo gave me this bottle poured a black color with aromas of roast and rich dark malts, Flavors are the same a solid to style beer. Thanks Timo.

33cl bottle from alko. Pours with thick dark head, pitch black liquid. Aroma is roasted malt, with coffee and little bit of chocolate in there.Light sweetness, medium to heavy bitterness. Dry finish. Really good.
black, clear, tan foam, chocolate, coffee, roasty, grass, vanilla, smoke, earthy, heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, sticky, soft carbonation, long finish, not abv worthy.
Black with a brown head - Roasted malt aroma - Roasted malt body with bitterness from the roasted malt - Bitter roasted malt finish - This was nice

UPDATED: MAY 7, 2016 Bottle, bb 07.08.2015 (shared by fatphil, thanks). Pours dark brown with light brown head. The head stays for some moments. Aroma is sweet, caramel, malt, fruity. Flavor is sweet, malt, caramel, somewhat metallic, roast. Body is thin. Finish is roast bitter. Alcohol is well covered. Overall: good, but would like to try fresher version. fresh version: more bitter, more, crisp +to flavor.

UPDATED: MAY 10, 2016 Fresher sample by Phil. Dark brown, tan head. Chocolate, soy sauce, mild acidity and roast. Pretty mild and drinkable.  BB 08.15. Brown beer, small brown head. Roasty nose, hops, slightly oxidized. Flavor is roast, burned notes, metal. Finish is slightly nutty, roast. Thin, metalic, nutty. Must try a fresh one.

Pours pitch black with an inch of tan foam. (after settling down)

Smells of roasted malt that goes a step further. Smokey as in burnt. Also some sweet malty notes. 

Roasted malt and yes, smokey, burnt, yet has its sweeter side. A certainly different Baltic Porter than Im used to but its good. 

The body just eeks into medium territory. 

My first Finnish beer, I reckon.

Pours black with a thin, tan head. Aroma has great notes of dark chocolate, dark fruits, coffee, cola, caramel, spice, vanilla, cinnamon, and a nuttiness. Taste is balanced lots of dark chocolate, caramel, coffee bitterness, nuts shells, toffee, spice, and a drawn out, bitter ending. Medium-full body with a medium carbonation. Clean in the mouth with a bone dry finish. Overall a nice dark beer. Lots of dark chocolate, coffee, caramel, and cola notes.

Bottle; pours dark brown with a mocha colored head; aroma of roasted malt and coffee with some chocolate and dark fruits; taste is smooth with chocolate, dark fruits, roasted malt and touch of coffee; finish is dry and lightly roasted coffee; excellent porter

Bottle, vintage 2009. (Bought in the US?)

Black with a tan head. Balanced with roasted malt, dried fruit, chocolate and caramel. Also some hints of coffee in the finish. A relaxed and easy to drink one with a medium body and light carbonation.

33 cl bottle from Systembolaget. Black with a medium beige head. Malty aroma with caramel and roast; some dark chocolate, coffee and dried fruits. Taste reflects the aroma, but is even more malty. Medium bodied. Low bitterness. And medium carbonation. + for the affordable price.

Very dark brown with a foamy tan head, loads of big bubbles. Dusty baking chocolate and coffee, has a sweet, tangy flavor. Coffee is prominent but not overwhelming, has an unusual lingering aftertaste, still pretty darned good!
Thanks to rosenbergh for this treat, Mahalo Jan!
Bottle, 33 cl, labelled Porter IV. Overall nice, pleasant carbonation, small finish. Well balanced aroma of coffee, not too prominent.

2009 Vintage released by B. United. Soft and roasty from front to back. Nice carbonation, layers of cocoa dusted compost, roasted grain, chewy bread, nuances of anise and malted milk. Delicious porter !
Bottle. Pours black with a creamy brown head. Bitter chocolate, coffee, roasted malt, alcohol, hops and dark fruit in the taste and aroma. Very good

Almost black, really nice dark colour with little dark tan head. Aroma: alcoholic, dried mullberry, lots of cacao, coffee, raisins. Tastes like above, dominant dark coffee taste. Would be more enjoyable with desert.

330 ml bottle shared by Kavu, thanks!
Dark brown body, with a medium, dense, creamy, dark beige head.
Aroma of chocolate, cocoa, coffee, some liquorice, dark fruits.
Tastes of coffee, dark chocolate, cocoa, powder, liquorice, some caramel, some dark fruits.
Quite full, creamy mouthfeel, with a soft carbonation.
Finishes smooth, dry, with coffee, cocoa powder, liquorice, dark chocolate.

Very nice. Smooth and pleasantly dry, with lovely coffee notes. Really well balanced, with just enough sweetness to balance the dry roastiness. Among the best Baltic Porters Ive had so far.

0,33l bottle at home shared by Kavu & wiosna, big thanks. BB 02/2016. black color, small dark coffee-colored head. smells of coffee, spices, roast, herbs, light alcohol. full body, light carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes roasted, herbs, light coffee, licorice, spices. finishes with spices and roast notes. quite good one nice roast and licorice notes.

Poured from a 330 ML bottle into a snifter at the World of Beer in Cary, NC. Wow, the appearance is pure black gold with a small creamy tan head . The aroma is full of malt, coffee bean and cocoa. . . outstanding. The flavor is pure malt heaven and is very rich. An outstanding porter.

Looks pitch black with a creamy brown head. Oily texture and strong roast for my first notes. The sweetness is kept low, thats good. Full bodied and just enough carbonation to get it going. Finishes with bitterness and ash. Its a good porter and it doesnt cost as much as craft beer.

Bottle from Euro Local Swap 3/2015, cheers VastActiv! Pours black with a tan head. Roast, smoke, milk chocolate, coffee, chalk, candy sugar, dark fruit. Oily to creamy texture, a bit thin body, lingering roasty finish. Nice.
Kølsvart ,med brunt skum. Intens duft med kaffe, lakris og brunt sukker. Smaken domineres av lakris og knekk. Fin bitterhet, men også litt søt mot slutten. Kunne med fordel vørt litt fyldigere,

Bottled 330ml. -Deep black coloured, small brownish head, heavy chocolate and licorice in the nose. Roasted malt, chocolate, licorice, dried fruits and notes of coffee with moderate strong smoke presence in rather roasty finish. Enjoyable porter.
Dark brown color, small brown head. Aroma of roasty malts, dried fruits, bit of alcohol. Smooth mouthfeel, roasty, malty taste. Bitter smoked aftertaste. Amazing porter

Aroma of soy and alcohol. Slightly watery, above-average carbonation. Precise taste, might be because its such a familiar beer. Hints of raisin, citrus and floral flavor. Great porter and great choice when in a Finnish bar -almost all the places have this, and its cheap, as well.

330ml bottle from Systembolaget. Black with a creamy tan head, leaves lacing. The aroma is sweet, roasted malt, raisins, dark dried fruit. Easy to drink with medium / full bodied, smooth mouthfeel. Taste got roasted malt, dark chocolate, dried plums, smoked ham. Finishing with chocolate bitterness.

Porter from 2007 sampled 2011.
Thick lasting brown head. Big soy aroma with a bit of chrystal malts and chocolat.
Soft taste with just a tuch of coffey and chocolate. Smooth roaste maltiness.
A litle bit tired.
Dark brown color, light brown head. Roasted malt nose, brown sugar, chocolate, licorice. Roasted malt taste, sweet, chocolate, licorice, moderate bitterness. Medium body, average carbonation.
Bottle. Pours very dark drown with a huge magnificent head and a lot of lacing. Aroma is dominated by roast malts, mostly liquorice. Strong bitter taste, but not killing the flavours.

11.2 ounce bottle thanks to drsilverworm. The beer is a dark brown to black with a khaki head of foam. Good lacing and decent retention. The aroma has licorice, ash, roast, coffee, and caramel. The taste has a bit of smoke to it, but is mostly a roasty sweetness. I get a bit of vanilla and wood character from this beer as well. There really is quite a bit going on here. Thicker, more viscous mouthfeel with tiny carbonation bubbles keeping the beer lively as it coats the tongue. Really nice stuff.
Bottle. Deep dark maroon brown color, tan head. Nice aroma of dark coffee, dates, plums. Taste has coffee, dark fruit, toffee. Delicious.
shared with yves ath home black colored body with an off white head and a chocolate malt hops liquor aroma a malt hops alcholic fruity sweet taste with a alcholic bitter finish
Shared with wim at wims place. Black colored beer with small off-white head and no carbonation. Malty fruited liqor aroma. Full sparkling palate. Finish is bitter malted roasted bitter.
Pours black with minimal light brown head. Aroma is sweet liquorice, syrup, very nice. Taste is mild, sweet and malty, with some roasty, coffeeish tones in the finish. Overall a nice smooth porter!

Pours a rich mahogany body topped with a dark chestnut head. Espresso and cocoa nose with hints of tobacco. Taste is dark chocolate and earthy coffee flavors. Chewy mouthfeel, touch of dark berries embedded within. Dry, moderately bitter finish. Thanks Leafs93.

Wyczuwalny delikatny aromat wędzonki, ponadto gorzka czekolada i słodowość. Sporo ciała, konsystencja oleista, barwa prawie nieprzejrzysta. Piwo dość wytrawne, alkohol wyczuwalny, delikatnie kawowe - lurowate americano, goryczka średnia niezalegająca - okej.
Pours dark brown. A very strong taste of coffee mixing with chocolate, slight hint of alcohol in the background. A dark taste, a little bit metallic. Liked it as a porter, tasty!
Bottle bought at Systembolaget. Pours black with small tan head. Chocolate/fruity aroma. Roasted malt taste. An average porter imho.
Malty aroma with hint an opaque dark brown color. Unremarkable taste not defined by any significant characteristic.

Poured from a bottle. Dark brown color, medium tan head. Strong malt aroma. Medium body with a light metallic malt flavor and a light finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Subdued aroma of malt and chocolate, pours a rich dark color and a tan well laced head. Taste of malt with a watery feel and a malty finish.

Bottle from rosenbergh. Pours almost pitch black with a big frothy dark tanned head. Roasted malty aroma. Taste is mild roasted, liquorice, tar and some caramel. Low carbonated, smooth creamy mouthfeel. Weak dry roasty finish.

Bottle from Drinks of the World, Geneva. Deep chocolate colour with a nice tan head. Sweet molasses aroma. The taste is sweet with chocolate, treacle, toffee and spice. Very tasty. Just a touch on the thin side.

Heavy roasted malt with a light nut and raisin aroma. Black body with medium brown half inch head. Deep roasted taste too. Feels thick and has a medium bitter quality. Has a dry puckering cocoa feeling too. Hint of nuttiness and dark fruit sweetness.Light warming sensation in the finish.
18.7.2014. Black, brown head. Roasted malts, low carbonation, very smooth. excellent for the price

330ml bottle. Dark brown shade with an initial large brown head. Aroma has quite a bit going on. Coffee, molasses, vanilla, nuttiness and chocolate brownie are my impressions. Taste is similar, with dark walnut, caramel and a lactosey sweetness. Bitter dark chocolate notes too. Plenty going on and some nice surprises, especially the walnut flavour. Good stuff.

Hopeless jet black color, cardboard brown finger of head. 

Aroma is roasted, toaste chocolate and mocha. Burnt cookie bottoms. There is a plum and slightly puckery raisin. The scent is absolutely superior. It is very European -- deep malts, no hope presence -- but it holds up to an American RIS in the nose.

The flavor is sweeter than expected: more toffee, caramel, and a touch of cocoa. The plum is much more prominent in the flavor. It is a "soft" flavor, might have mellowed out from the long trip overseas. Does have a toasted aftertaste, almost like a marshmallow.

The feel is very soft and pillowy. Its a terrific, biggish beer: slaps your face but then catches you and gently lowers you to the ground.
Darrrrk. Roasted malt and coffee at first followed by a slightly sour milkiness. Grand beer.

I drink alot of Sinebrychoffs stuff, ALOT. Most of it is macro lager style piss. Walked pass this one a number off times due to this fact. Finally picked one up and i´m impressed.

Pours jet black. Aroma is a little sedated compared to other stout and porters at this strength but the taste weighs up the score for sure. Nice roasted malts and coffee, slight hint of dark chocolate. Very pleasant beer from a run of the mill large brewery. I like!

Bottle from Alko.

Thanks to kevnic2008 for that one! Bottle looks really good. Beer in the glass deep black, nice brownish head. Starts intense malty, fine roasty, soft, not too dry. Light sweetish background. Finish more and more dry without being too much. Goes down warming. Soft-malty aftertaste. Nice!
Really dark brown color, brown head medium size. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, vanilla and dark chocolate. Small sweetness, medium bitterness.

Pour is deep, dark seal brown with sizable umber head, which reduces quickly but leaves nice lacing.
Aroma is sweet malt, raisins and pickled fruit, bread and toast. In the glass, theres chalky coffee, rye bread, minor chocolate and a hint of caramel quickly lost in a pronounced bitter but lightly fruited and vegetable finish. A lot to like, but somewhat of a jumble.
This is a solid dark Baltic winter brew with an eccentric flavor profile. At 7.2 ABV, Ill have another, but then switch to something crisper.

Pours black with a 2-inches of frothy, medium-brown head. Should really be labeled a Baltic stout based strictly on the color. Aroma is salty chocolate toasted rye and whole-grain bread. Body is creamy-oily with light, soft, medium-coarseness carbonation, little burn. Flavor is moderate-to-big chocolate, some bread, light honey. Oats cookie. Yeasty dough. Delicious. Hell yeah!

Bottle from Champanes, 
this beer had a dark brown, almost black pour and gave a half finger or more dark tan head that receded to a ring and scattered film on top, 

the nose had aromas of dark cocoa, roasted malt, caramel, dark hard candy, hints of earth and coffee in the background, 
there was some brown sugar & molasses sweetness, 

the flavors were roasted malt, coffee and bitter chocolate, a little dark candy caramel and molasses sweetness, 
the finish had a good bit of roasted malt bitterness that balanced the sweetness, the roasted malt bitterness lingered on the mouth, 

it had a medium to full mouth feel and was pretty creamy on the lips, and it had average carbonation, 

a big roasty malt porter with bitter chocolate and coffee, this beer had pretty intense roasted malt notes, a good drink.

Pretty good Baltic. Definitely not very sweet but has a lot of malt background. Not bitter though either. Just sort of neutral on the tongue with a slight tartness near the finish. Dry and some smoke flavor as well.

Crazy beer. Not what I expected. Black pour from 12oz bottle at three Floyds. Super sweet aroma and flavor. 
Vanilla and cocoa and maybe cherry. Wow.
Bottle..Pour is dark black with a tan head..Nose is roast, chocolate, sweetness, dry..Taste is roast, dry, spice, chocolate, spice, finnish must
How: Bottle Apperance: Black, brown head. Aroma: dried fruits, bread, chocolate, caramel. Palate: medium body, medium carbonation. Nice bitter finish.
Dark smoked malts on aroma. Taste is balanced, dark smoked malts with some hops. Interesting mouthfeel.

Found bottle at a local winery. Nice toasted malt aroma and taste with some dark fruit. Low bitterness and medium mouthfeel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhoneEarlier Rating: 1/20/2014 Total Score: 3.82013 bottle to a snifter. Pours a dark brown/black with a medium dark tan head. Aroma is dark, roasty malt with some prune and maybe a hint of soy sauce. Taste is dark brewed coffee, touch of soy sauce, some dark chocolate, and a little mineral taste. Finishes with a roasted and slightly woody bitterness. Overall, kind of savory. Thin medium mouthfeel. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours an almost black colour with a small pale brown head. Nose of dark chocolate, roasted malt and prunes. Taste of roasted bread and salty licorice. Full-bodied with oily texture and a soft carbonaton. The finish is smooth with an eminent taste of alcohol. A good porter.

(Sinebrychoff Koff Porter) As Sinebrychoff Porter IV. I got this through a Euro Swap, dont remember from whom but thanks! Into a snifter, ABV 7.2%
Black as the night in colour with one finger of brown head, thick, with very good retention, leaving medium lacing on the glass.
Aroma has chocolate, light vanilla, some port wine.
Taste follows, a bit sweet with chocolate, cake, fruity notes, faint roasted malts on the finish.
Medium body, good soft carbonation.
Nice.

Flaska från SB. Knappt ett år gammal. Stor maffig doft. Nybakt mörkt rågbröd, kaffe, choklad, soja, sötlakrits och chokladfudge. Tjock, relativt söt, mjuk munkänsla. Otroligt fina rostade smaker i linje med doften. Lätt rostad beska. lång eftersmak. Smakintensitet som en Imperial Porter men väldigt lättdrucken. Otroligt god.

Bottle as a gift from Espoo. BB 07.08.2015. Pours a thick red-hued black with a tan head. Retains, laces. Nose is initially kind of sour, reminds me of "raw" bread and even sauerkraut, with roasty aspects way back there somewhere. Taste on the other hand is hop-driven at first, then roasted malts rise forward. Letting it warm for some time... Now, after some 20 minutes, the heads dropped to a film, thicker around the edge, lacing still good. Aroma is very nice roasty ashy dry chocolaty cocoa bitter, coffee, figs and plums, seaweed and marmalade. Taste is roasted malts, dark fruits, nicely balanced sweet and bitter, black bread, molasses. Full body, thick syrupy palate backed up by the rather lively carbonation, texture smooth and only somewhat grainy. Expected it to be better but still good.

Deep dark brown colour, moderate sized quickly collapsing brown head; complex aroma of coffee, dried fruits, liqueur, some vanilla and spicy alcohol; taste of coffee, chocolate, herbal liqueur notes and some alcohol - excellent baltic porter
Svart med høyt lys brunt skum. Lukter melkesjokolade, kaffe og malt. Søt lett bitterhet kort lite kullsyre

Black color with a brown head. Aromas of chocolate, slight coffee and dark fruits. Similar taste, dark cholotate, dark fruits, some slight coffee notes. Aftertaste is mild bitter and long. Medium body with low carbonation.
Bottle. Opaque black color and brown thick head. Aroma has caramel, chocolate and ripe fruits. Dry and bitter taste with long finish. Chocolate, spices, caramel and licorice.

Poured from bottle, dark dark brown with medium creamy brown/grey head. Aroma is strong and inviting, notes of chocolate, dark bread, dried fruit and syrup. Taste is bittersweet with a nice body and a long lasting sweet and bitter taste. Very nice!
Black color, medium brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, hint of smoked bacon. Taste has similar notes, dry with mild bitterness in finish. Medium body and average carbonation.

Many thanks to rosenbergh.  The beer starts intense malty-loqourice. Thick and smooth. Bitter-smooth, easy to drink and heavy malty. The aftertaste is smooth-malty, bitter with a nice sweetish-heavy malty body. On the tongue remains a sweetisg-malty, bitter aroma. Thick and intense, not too sweet. Great!
Bottle from SB. Pours two fingers of head. Aroma: chocolate, roasted barley. Taste: creamy, caramel, tofee. An excellent porter!

330 ml bottle into snifter, best before 11/4/2013. Pours pitch black color with a 1-2 finger dense brown head with good retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings around the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of big chocolate, cocoa, coffee, toast, dark bread, molasses, raisin, prune, fig, licorice, light smoke/char, and roasted earthiness. Incredible aromas with great balance and complexity of dark/roasted malt and dark fruit notes; with good strength. Taste of chocolate, cocoa, coffee, toast, dark bread, molasses, raisin, prune, fig, licorice, light smoke/char, and roasted earthiness. Fair amount of roasted bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of chocolate, cocoa, coffee, toast, dark bread, molasses, raisin, prune, fig, licorice, light smoke/char, and roasted earthiness on the finish for a while. Incredible complexity, balance, and robustness of dark/roasted malt and dark fruit flavors; with a nice roasted bitterness/sweetness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Light-medium carbonation and medium-full bodied; with a very smooth, creamy, and lightly slick/chalky mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is well hidden with minimal warming present after the finish. Overall this is an incredible Baltic porter. All around awesome complexity and balance of dark/roasted malt and dark fruit flavors; and very smooth to drink. A highly enjoyable offering.
Black color, medium brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, hint of smoked bacon. Taste has similar notes, dry with mild bitterness in finish. Medium body and average carbonation. Nice dry porter.

330 mL bottle from my parents at Christmas! Thanks guys! The pour is a beautiful light black with a dark khaki head that fades down to a thin ring. The aroma is nice. Roasty with a good dark chocolate scent. There are hints of dark fruits and a nice balance of roast. I'm a fan. The flavor has a little more licorice going on, but it's very similar to the aroma. Roasty with a beautiful dark fruit and wonderful chocolate. The mouthfeel is a bit thin and lacking. The carbonation doesn't help at all, and the finish is just a little light. This is pretty much the only area of lacking. Pretty good

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dark color, nice body. Smooth aromas of roasted malt. Nice flavor. Not too strong or bitter. Very balanced and enjoyable. I can have plenty of those.
"fruity and sweet aroma and taste with tons of dark chocolate,fruit and licorice. almost too much going on, but they manage to pull it off. Thick and syrupy as well."
Many thanks for this bottle to Rosenbergh & Nisse666. Pours black with a medium beige head. The aroma malty and dark roasted with some fruity notes. The flavour is deep roasted and malty.

Bottle from a supermarket in Porvoo. Poured a deep oily black colour with a frothy tan head. The aroma is roasted sweet malt, light coffee, creamy caramel. The flavour is moderate bitter, light sweet with a big, rich oily malt,, dark chocolate bitter palate. Full bodied with soft carbonation and a rich oily mouthfeel. God this was good and totally unexpected!

(33 cl bottle from Systembolaget poured into a burgundy glass; BBD: 04.11.2015 E3 3084 L) Pours pitch black with luscious three finger tofee head. Impressive retention and beautiful lace. Aroma is dark and sweet with notes of molasses and dried fruit. Oily texture, full body, soft carbonation and a lingering finish. Flavour has a bit of roasted bitterness which balances the dominant sweetness nicely and manages to avoid any ascerbic character.

Served on-tap at TJs into a nonic pint.


A - Pours jet black with a small half finger tall khaki colored head leaving faint wisps of lacing down the length of the glass.


S - Smells of darkness thru and thru. Huge amount of dark roast; mostly dark chocolate malt, espresso, and burnt wood; mixes well with a light molasses sweetness. Nothing too over the top, just a solid nose.


T - Plenty of dark roasted chocolate malt up front quickly giving way to a mix of espresso coffee beans, charred wood, and some light molasses sweetness. The alcohol creeps in toward the end but it blends in pretty well. The finish is mostly dark roast with a bit of lingering sweetness. The smoke grows stronger as is warms, threatening to overrun everything else but it stops just short. Tone the smoke back a bit and this one would be VERY good.


M - Heavy body and flavor with moderate carbonation. Big smokey feel to this one that carries over into the finish, mixing with some lingering sweetness.


O - Not too bad. I really enjoyed how rustic this one was, with plenty of simple flavors working in tandem to create an overall good beer. Very nice stuff.

I love it when this happen: when a beer Ive never heard about before from an unknown (to me, at least) brewery turns out to be an utter masterpiece! It pours a viscous black body with a rather large, creamy, dense, medium brown head that is very long-lived and that laces the glass excellently. The sweet aroma is very strong and has lovely roasted notes and a smooth and delicious mix of dark caramel and chocolate. In the very strong flavour I also get some pleasant notes of dry coffee, but the caramel and chocolate are more obvious. It might be a simple flavour profile without any fancy hoppy notes, but it works for me. The taste is moderate sweet, and the long-lasting finish is moderate bitter. The mouthfeel is unusually pleasant, its creamy with a soft carbonation and a full body. Wow! Just wow!
[33 cl bottle, enjoyed 15 months before BB date, from Systembolaget Gårda, Göteborg]
11 oz bottle pours black with a tan head. Aroma of malts and coffee. Taste is malts, coffee and a little sour.
Pours black with thick tan head. Malty aroma with roasted coffee. Slightly bitter overall taste, not overpoweringly roasty. Soft mouthfeel, medium carbonation.

One of a small league of archetypical, historically important Baltic porters, with thin but stable, deep beige head and totally jet black colour through which no light whatsoever can penetrate. Dry and assertive aroma of coffee powder, leather, nutmeg, dried banana, caramel and bitter chocolate. Strong and deep dark malts in the mouth, lots of roasted bitterness, oily texture, some cocoa but coffee-like taste predominates, vague candied fruit sweetishness, hoppy finish. Powerful beer with loads of personality.

UPDATED: NOV 1, 2014 0,33 pullo@ St.Urho. syvän ruskea ja samea. Tuoksussa paahteisuutta vahvasti, mutta ei hyökkäävästi, ruista ja humalaa. Maku paahteinen mallas, hiukan kirpeä, ei liian paksu vaan kevyehkö. Rautainen, vähän kahvinen.
Great flavors of burnt caramel and chocolate which unfortunately is taken down a bit of a pushy alcohol taste.

330 ml bottle. A black beer with no head. Aroma of roasted malt, dark chocolate, liquorice and alcohol. Sweet flavour of roasted malt, dark chocolate, dried fruit, liquorice and a bitter coffee finish. Full body, with a creamy, oily texture and flat carbonation.

Bottle from Systemet. 
Pours a tar black with a brown firm head. Molasses and coffee in the aroma and powerful body with dark roasted coffee, dark chocolate. 
A very nice stouty porter. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Systembolaget. Pours dark brown/black with a dense brown head. Aroma is roasted malt, chocolate, light ash and smoke. Taste is medium bitter roasted with ash and a light/medium licorice and malty sweetness. Medium bodied, average carbonation.
Tar black. Medium head, colored like pepparkaksdeg. Smooth mouthfeel. Smoky dominance. Hops and herbs, prunes and licorice root, syrup and bitter chocolate. Somewhat acidy, but not too much. Sweet.

Kind of a boring, straightforward take on the style, roasty and more stoutlike in flavor than most Baltic Porters Ive had, but with the body that is typical of the style. Tasty and certainly worth the 3 bucks I spent, but not nearly as delicious as the peak beers in the style.

Pullosta tuoppiin kaataessa näyttää kuin pahasti karstoittunutta, mutta kermaista öljyä kaataisi. Tuoksu on sopivan kutsuva ja antaa pientä esivivahdetta vahvasta mausta. Maku ja jälkimaku ovat paksut ja aromikkaat. Tykkään.

Pour out of bottle, dark brownish black pour with tan head, aroma brought notes of caramel, roast, ashy, coffee notes, hints of dark cocoa, slight yeast, touch of grain. Taste is a mix of some slight roast, cardboard, ashy, cardboard, slight yeast, finishing fairly bitter, slightly sweet.

Pours a very dark brown with a short-lived, but mocha colored head. Very pungent smoky olive nose. Not quite as thick as expected, but smooth. Fruity, chocolate covered raisins, and prunes. Prune gets progressively bitter at the finish.

Purchased at Binnys in Chicago, IL; enjoyed after my first visit to the nordic countries. I couldnt find this Finnish brew when I was in Sweden, but sure enough they have it in Chicago, hence I bought it. Appearance is a thick pitch black with a light tan head that quickly dissipates. Aroma of chocolate malt, light molasses, light cough syrup. Taste goes down with a syrupy chocolate flavor, light burn, light hop profile, overall a decent baltic porter. There was dust on the bottle, therefore Im concerned its not as fresh, but its still pretty good.

(Bottle). Sweet and slightly metallic scent of roasted malt and hops. Taste of slightly burnt malt, hops and alcohol. Especially in the aftertaste flavor of alcohol. Strange how this beer can get so good ratings, Im not impressed!

33cl, Hemma, 16/4-14, Bäst före: 27-12-2014
U: Kolsvart, stort kompakt fluffigt krämigt brunt skum som klänger snyggt längs glaskanten. 
D: Söt rostad och något syrligt askig doft med choklad, bränt trä, lite rökt chark, aska och lite röda bär. Lite vaxduk kikar fram efter en stund. 
S: Söt och bränt rostad med syrligt askigt/bärigt avslut. Choklad, aska, citrus & röda bär, trä och läder. 
M: Medelstor till större kropp med mjuk fyllig kolsyra och len textur. 
T: En riktigt trevlig baltic stout med bra drag i de rostade smakerna. Lite askig och syrlig, men det vägs upp rätt bra av chokladsmaken. Kroppen klenar ur lite.

Bottle from rosenbergh, many thanks! 
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein sehr dunkelbraunes fast schwarzes Bier mit schöner bräunlichen Schaumkrone. Geruch schokoladig, dunkle Früchte, Kaffee. Geschmack röstmalzig, dunkle Früchte, leicht alkoholisch, einfach lecker!

Big chestnut head, good lacing, on opaque black body. Aroma is dark malt and dried plums. Flavor is dark chocolate and raisins, touch of yeast and iron, molasses, and mildly bitter black malt finish. Body is a little thin, carbonation fine, a little bit on the high side for style. Metal taste is persistent. Otherwise this is very good.
Bottle from Systembolaget. Coffee and dark chocolate on the nose. Similar taste, roasted notes. Very nice!
Bottle. Pours nearly black color, nice stable dark beige head - really nice appearance. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, dried fruits. Taste is sweet, medium bitter, coffee, roasted malt, cocoa. Nice one!
This is the solid choice from finnish Alko. Taste is round, thick and malty. Very nice drink to enjoy sipping slowly.

What I found in Finland and the Baltics, was that when it came to "old" style beers (pre-craft beer revolution), the lagers were quite dreadful, while the "under appreciated" porters (Baltic) were really good, of fine quality and style. This one was roasty with a good hop profiel, nice ashy afternotes and unfiltered as well. A good 7.2 made it a top notch Porter in my opinion.

@ Havregatan. Flaska från Systembolaget (20:-). Rostad malt, karamell, kaffe, choklad, lakrits, charkuterier, sötma, medelfyllig till fyllig, oljig konsistens. Avslutningen torr och besk med rejält rostade toner.

At a tasting, many thanks rosenbergh, stable long lasting creamy  deepish mocha head, opaque black colour, aroma of vanila, light roastiness, dark bread and some mushrooms, flavour of dirt, chocolate cake, bitter choclate, some cocoa and just a hint of carob, medium mellow bitterness. Nice and solid, highly enjoyable.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Beer Market Jaffa. Thanks tomer. Pours opaque black with a huge beige head, aroma of chocolate, dried fruits, caramel and spices, flavor is roasted with chocolate, coffee, caramel, dried fruits, medium bodied.
Pours dark brown towards black with minimal head to the glass. Aroma of coffee, malt and some dried fruits. Taste is medium sweet in the beginning with a bitter ending.

BOTTLE 33CL from rosenbergh. Thanks, Jan!

Look: virtually black with red highlights and a decent espresso head.
Aroma: black malts, chocolate, dark caramel, some dried fruit as it warms up. Medium intensity.
Taste: quite sweet, light roast, balanced by solid hop bitterness, dried fruit, charry finish.
Decent, but not very intense.

Bottle from Systembolaget Hansa, Malmö. Black with a big and lasting brown head. Aroma is dry, roasted malt, licorice and minor notes of rye bread. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and roasted rather bitter finish. 150414

Tight cocoa cream, lots of curtain laceworks down the mug, black brown black body.
Scents; chocolate caramel malts, hints from coffee, sweet liquorice, 
faint dusty meadows with flowers and berries.
Taste; distinct dark roasted fruity malts, sweet fruity liquorice, some coffee notes, prunes, chocolate.
Easy alright on palate, good body. 
Ends with the fruity chocolate sauce from malts, grainy sweet hops, sweet roastiness, lingering a bit.
Overall really tasty.

Bottle 33 cl. Pours dark black with brown frothy head. Notes of liquorice, roasted malts, chocolate, caramel, nuts, earthy. Very tasty brew.
Nice dark colour with brown head. Soft and creamy taste with caramel and chocolate hints. Soft palate and easy to drink. I am not the biggest porter fan but this one is really good overall.

Bottle [thanks to tiong] @ home shared with Illuvatarmilan. Opaque pitch black color, full sized a bit creamy brown head. Aroma is malts, coffee, dark malts, dark fruits. Taste malts, dark malts, dark fruits, nicely bitter in the end, but a touch of sweetness at first. Nice!
7,2% alcohol, but Nothing comes through, Nothing. Nice, roasty Taste. Foamy, balanced, full taste. Very nice beer.
Dark brown to black. Smell is quite fresch and rosted hints. Taste is big, complex malty with coffe, hints of chocolate, rosted malt. High bitterness. Bit of fresch citrus.
malty, roasty aroma. pitch black with a decent head. taste is very roasty with a strong malt flavor.
Good porter, with traditional coffee, chocolate, and pretty nice level of carbonization. Ok balance, and in general tasty.

Fin färg med något konstig doft när man hällde upp den. Mycket jästigdoft. Helt okej men inte en av favoriterna.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330ml bottle.
Courtesy of rosenbergh. Many thanks, Jan!. 
Pours very dark with quite tan frothy head. Short head retention, some lacing. Roasty, chocolate and spicy aromas. Medium body, average carbonation, silky texture. Taste is roasty, caramel, chocolate, spicy. Very well balanced, smooth and quite enjoyable.

Bottle 33 cl from Systembolaget. Black with a light brown head with fine bubbles. Roasty, malty, earthy hops, somewhat bitter, slight chocolate tones. Medium/full body, low carbonation, slightly bitter finish. Smooth, nice porter.
Tungs rostade toner, kraftig i smaken, helt okej balans i kroppen med en bra kolsyra.

Bottle. Pours a black color with a longlasting tan head. Has a roasted malty chocolate and caramel aroma. Roadted malty bitter chocolate flavor with hints of caramel. Has a roasted malty bitter chocolate finish.

Ar: chocolate, roasty, toast, alcohol, grass, earthy, leather, soy sauce, vanilla, slightly fruity.
Ap: black colour, medium Brown head, lacing.
T: medium bite, noticable sweetness, salty and very metallic, ABV evident.
P: medium body, soft carbonation, sweet and salty finish
O: ok

Recommended by the bartender at the Old Bank, this is a fantastic Finnish porter. Not too heavy in any way, nice earthy/ mineral flavors. This was a smooth drinking and clean finishing beer. The end of the glass did not get too bitter. For a stronger beer, none of the alcohol comes through. Bottled version held up as well, easily just as good.

Bottle @ home. Pours dark red/brown with a brown large head and nice lacing. Sweet toffee aroma initially. Lots of coffee and figs, Theres leather and some dark chocolate, and more fruitiness apart from figs there are also notes of dry apple and dates, Tar and dry smoked wood , really appealing. Vinous notes appears as it gets warmer. Sweet and dry taste with a distinct earthy and dark chocolate like bitterness in the finish. Medium body and smooth soft carbonation. Taste has coffee, lots of it. Toffee, dark chocolate, dark bread,figs, tar and ash, notes of dry raisins, wood and vanilla. I really appreciated this one, it has a unique, well balanced and complex profile.
Jomen, det här var ingen dum sak. Smaken var komplex och kraftig med toner av choklad, kaffe, kola och en lätt nyans av syra. Kroppen var stabil men balansen satt inte där den skulle.

Pours dark dark brown with low brown head
Aromas of tar, dark malts, hints bread, dark fruits, coffee, chocolate
Taste is nice sweet with a low to medium well balanced bitterness. Has roasted malts, coffee, hints of chocolate
Kompakt svart med lite brunt skum. Tydlig kaffekaraktär i doft och smak. Alkoholen slår inte igenom särskilt mycket. Kaffesmaken dröjer sig kvar i munnen.
Flaska från Systembolaget. Mörkbrun/svart vätska med beige-brunt skum. Söt doft. Börjar söt i munnen men övergår till en dominerande kaffesmak.
Flaska från SB. Svart vätska med kaffebrunt skum. Doft av rostat kaffe, choklad och sylt. Rökig i smaken med lite syltsötma. Nedtonad spritighet, rivig.
UPDATED: FEB 6, 2014 Bottle. A decent porter though not as sweet and full bodied as most other porters I have had. Refreshingly bitter though.

Draft. Black with a thin mocha colored head. Aroma is lots of dark fruit, especially figs. Somewhat vinous. Taste follows suit and adds some really nice smokey and roasted malt notes. Smooth rich palate. Excellent.

Aroma: Smelling of dark fruits, figs, dates, coffee and chocolate.Appearance: A dark brown colored beer. A brown head with some lacing and good curtains.Taste: Tasting bread, figs, chocolate and grass.Palate: Medium low carbonation, a soft texture. A medium body.Overall: A bit thin in spite of 7.2%Note: Bottle 330 ml at home. Reviewed 2014-01-29.

Sinebrychoff Koff Porter
Skum 2 cm tykt brunt skum
Duft:sødme frugtig, Brandt malt.,
Smag: ristet. frugtig. lav fylde. eftersmag af Brandt og mørk ristet malt. en smule smag af chokolade
330ml bottle. Dark brown body with a huge mocca coloured head. Roasted malt, chocolate, soy, a hint of smoke, rich and complex without being too strong.

Flaska från SB. Nästan helt svart öl med stort moccafärgat skum. Dofter av kakao, sötlakrits, aska och läder. Smakinslag av mörk choklad, kaffe, soja, vanilj och rostade nötter. Behaglig beska. Torr munkänsla.

Pours an opaque black with a good sized tan head and good lacing. Aroma of chocolate and some dark fruit with slight smell of oxidation. Taste has chocolate and coffee first then some roasted character and some mustiness and leather from oxidation. Finishes with some roasted coffee flavor. Mouthfeel is semi creamy with a medium/full body and low carbonation. Very flavorful and good but I would like to have a fresher bottle with a little less oxidation.

Appearance: Black as the deepest dungeon. A nice big beige head that leaves a fine lacing.Aroma: Coffee, chocolate and mild roasted dark malt.Palate: Medium + body. Tad sweet with an ok bitterness. Average to soft carbonation.Taste: Coffee, licorice, mild leather and roasty.Overall impression: Powerful taste in this one.Personal stats: Bottle from Systembolaget in Strömstad, Sweden.
Complex aroma of chocolate and coffee. The taste is similar but a litrle thin. Low carbonation.

330 ml bottle @ home. Beer called Sinebrychoff Porter IV.
January 15, 2014
Beer bought @ Systembolaget, Strømstad
Beer from a pint glass
Black in color with a thick and creamy brown head and medium carbonation.
Aroma is roasted malt,coffee,some soy sauce and smoke.
Tastes malty,espresso and a bit sweet with a hoppy bitter finish.
Enjoyable porter to be bought again when possible

Bottle.
Black with a small espresso head.
Soy, dark chocolate, coffee and roasted malt in aroma.
Taste is pretty much the same but with slight tartness and mineral.
Medium body, low carbonation. Dry.
Dry bitter after taste with slight alcohol.
Great porter that took me by surprise!

Poured into porter glass. It is very dark black with a caramel-colored head. Didnt leave much lace as I drank it. Aroma was roasted (burnt) coffee and a mild sweetness. My wife and I couldnt call the sweetness out by name until the next morning. I took a whiff of the warm remnants left in the glass and immediately picked up on raisins or prunes. Taste had average porter bitterness. Viscosity was above average and higher alcohol was apparent. Decent aftertaste. I think I actually served it too cold at first (maybe 40 deg or so). As it warmed, I really enjoyed it more.

33cl from Alko, Finland. Pours black with a beige head. Aroma of dark malts with dark fruits, dark chocolate and hints of light smoke. Sweet and full flavoured with a light bitterness. Well balanced and quite delicious.

On bottle with Visionthing, thanks a lot! Black color, ok foam. Some smoked aromas , also roasted as well as licorice, leather, malt; medium/ high aroma intensity. Medium/ full body/ high complexity. Some sweetness, good bitterness & balance. Very enjoyable
This beer suprises me. With that thick black colour and a nice head. Taste is coffee at first and some liqorice at the back. With that good looks i thought i was getting more tho.
Draught. Pours pitch black with small head and lace. Aroma is dark roast, espress lactic tang. Flavor is sour sweet, light smoke. Soft feel and unexpectedly lactic. Very rich taste and aroma.
33cl bottle. Pours black with a creamy beige head. Roasty chocolate malt aroma. Smooth creamy mouthfeel. Sweet flavor with dominant notes of chocolate. Absolutely top notch.

UPDATED: AUG 2, 2016 Voihan tämä muiden mielestä olla Suomen kovin olutta, mutta ei nyt sellainen elämys kyllä ole. Makuaistin tylsistyessä herättää Makuaistin. Tiettyihin tilanteisiin mainio. Mämminen alkutymäys.
Pitch black with brownish head. Aroma is superb. Roasted malts and sweet alcohol notes. Body is perfect, roasted malts and quite bitter although very drinkable. One of my favourite porters so far.

$9.50 for the 12 oz. spurt distributed in a tumbler at the Grog last Saturday evening. For some peculiar reason or another, I noted numerous herbal indications resembling marsh rosemary, spruce tips, and thyme, remembered whilst filling my body alongside semi-dark chocolate, raspberry jam, common figs, and toffee. Respectable, but I didnt find it all that exciting. Perhaps Ill have to rerate it and see if anything changes in my view.
Bottle. Black with a creamy brown head. Aroma is coffee, dark chocolate, syrup, licorice. Taste is roasty with some sweetness. Light to medium body, smooth mouthfeel.

Tap into half pint. Black, thin espresso foam color head. Nose mostly of Vettel and dark malt.In the mouth immediate sour note, like a Flemish sour. Hops mid way, and finishes with a more traditional dry roast. Not a typical porter by any means but really interesting and multilayered.
Lite aska och småsträv mot slutet annars riktigt fin porter. Doftar alejäst, lite estrar och fenoler. Prisvärd porter. Flaska från bolaget
On tap at bittercreek, black pour with minimal head. Fruity, sour but almost sweet overtones. Dry. Salty aftertaste. Thin body, medium carbonation. Weird tasting beer.

Bottle from Systembolaget. This is kinda funny. I have tried this beer several times, and I am pretty sure I have rated it once or even twice. But here we go again... Pitch black beer with a nice brownish head. Malty roasted aroma, fruity, raisins, cocoa, licorice notes. tar, coffee notes. Malty caramel flavor, vinous, raisins, figs, chocolate, grapes, cocoa, Cream notes, some licorice. Malty raisin finish with chocolate, caramel and some figs. Nice sweetish stout.

Bottle from SB. Very dark brown with a thick brown head. Malty and fruity tones. 
Malt, fruit, chocolate and coffee. Medium to full body with a nice, bitter sweet finish.

330ml bottle, labelled Sinebrychoff Porter IV. Pours brownish black with a small creamy light brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, dark chocolate and a hint of charcuteries. Taste of roasted malt, coffee, raisins, dark chocolate and toffee. Light Sweetness and medium bitterness. Medium-full body, creamy texture and soft carbonation. An excellent well balanced classic Baltic Porter from Finland.

Pours black with a finger of thick foamy tan head. Aroma of chocolate malts, light coffee, german sausage, light molasses. Taste is coffee bitter with light chocolate sweetness, bitter finish. Creamy fairly light body with average carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhoneEarlier Rating: 12/13/2013 Total Score: 3.4Pours black with a finger of thick foamy tan head. Aroma of chocolate malts, light coffee, german sausage, light molasses. Taste is coffee bitter with light chocolate sweetness, bitter finish. Creamy fairly light body with average carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nästan svart öl med ett brunt mellanstort skum. Doften känns till att börja med ganska torr. Rostad malt, lakrits och cacao. Efter ett tag dyker det upp vinösa tendenser och mörka bär. Gräddig munkänsla med smaker av choklad, kola och lätta tendenser av aska.

Poured from a bottle black with tan head. Little lacing. Aroma of chocolate and something metallic. Taste is mildly sweet, chocolate, malty. Theres a slight bitterness to the finish. Good carbonation. Full mouthfeel.

Bottle from Systembolaget.
Pours black with a big brown head.
Solid robust porter, roasted malt, dark chocolate and some hops.

Bouteille de 330 ml achetée chez Sawyers Specialties (Southwest Harbor, ME) au coût de 4.00$ US. Arôme: Très légère odeur de chocolat noir. Apparence: La couleur est noire opaque. Présence dun moyen col beige mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Légèr goût de chocolat noir et de vanille. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement onctueuse. Faible effervescence en bouche. Légère présence de vanille en arrière goût. (Rating #5371)
33cl bottle. Dark brown color, pretty light tan head. Aroma has light dark chocolate, nut and light coffee. Taste roasted wood, coffee. A bit light body and at least this one had bit too much carb.

[Thanks to oh6gdx]. Bottle. Black colour with a creamy tan head with medium lasting. Aroma is strong coffee with notes of licorice and light ripe fruit with roasted malts. Flavor isroasty, coffee beans and black chocolate, moderate bittery. Creamy and smooth on palate.

Bottle from Colonial Spirits
Pours a solid black color with a smallish tan head that dissipates to a small cap. The aroma is heavy with charred wood, and vinous oxidation, supported by dark fruits, smoke and dark chocolate. Little to no hop aroma or alcohol presence. The flavor is a hint of sweet sugar up front that quickly becomes smokey with light fruits and a bit of wine like flavor. A charred ashy flavor sweeps in and lingers long into the finish of every sip. Medium body with a light to moderate level of carbonation and a full almost gritty mouthfeel. Big burnt fruity Baltic porter. I warmed up to it after a while, but it is not my favorite example of the style.

Refrigerated 33 cl brown bottle poured into snifter. Pours black with dark brown highlights and small light brown head. Nice dark chocolate aroma, medium body, low carbonation, and some thin small bubble lacing. Taste is rich chocolate, some roasty, earthy hop balance, and dry coffee finish. Not a big fan of the dry finish, but pretty good.

33cl bottle. Light gray/dark head. Roasted malt, chocolate, nuts, coffee and liquorice aroma. Roasted malty taste, hints of nuts and coffee. Bitter, coffee and liquorice aftertaste. Excellent taste, very good.
cool. good, dark, nuts, roasts, chocolate, smooth, full body, slight heat, light acidity in the finish? Maybe Im wrong.

Bottle shared by a Finnish guy at Borefts 13, didnt catch your name - but big thanks, 28/09/13.
Mid black with no head.
Nose is roast malt, earthy, dark toffee.
Taste comprises cocoa powder, toffee, dark roast malt, earthy, light brown sugars.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, sweet finish with roasty tones.
Average affair.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle. Very dark brown - almost black, average and mostly diminishing light brown head. Moderate to full, malty and sweetish aroma, some roasted malt and light licorice, some herbal hoppyness. Body is medium to full, malty and lightly sweetish flavor, some roasted malt and light hoppyness Finish is average to long, malty and lightly sweetish, some roasted malt - faint burnt malt, light coffee and faint licorice, light - some herbal hoppyness. Used to be better recipe than nowadays. Cannot compete with Yeti or Plevna Siperia.
UPDATED: OCT 11, 2013 Pour is perfect and aroma is coffee and chocolate. Flavor strongly resembles Guinness, but is much less filling. Palate is somewhat oily rather than thick. Outstanding.
pours black, grey foam that imidiatly fades. smell is sweet, porter. sharp carbo . taste has chocolate, bitterness. good

I never thought a Baltic Porter would get any better than a Carnegie. But here it is. Finnish, but it sounds Swedish, just like my favourite band Finntroll. This was a bottle, from one of the retailers in Miami. I had it under the lovely Florida air conditioning interiors, and I can only dream of what it is when consumed in a Nordic winter. The beer pours like Aztec chocolate sauce, dark brown pure iodine, with a beautiful creamy head on top. Perfect also on the aroma of black currants/Crème de cassis, blackberries, dark chocolate, and a hint of vanilla. The flavour is just so farking perfect too, with dark, bitter chocolates, caramel, dulce de leche, honey, liquorice, tart berries and a touch of yogurt sourness. Theres a bitterness that balances perfectly against this baccanalle of sweetness, never allowing it to be cheap or cloying. The beer is creamy, velvety, thick and silky on the tongue. Perfect in every single aspect. Sinebrychoff Koff Porter this beer would get a full five if I ever decided that a beer could deserve a full five.

Bottled shared at Borefts 2013 by some guys from Finland - thanks! Black with a good beige head. Aroma is dates, roasted malts, hint of balsamic vinegar. Medium-light body, some fruit and unami on the palate. Taste is soy sauce, dates, roasted malts.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */13:
Back pour. Small brown lacing, black beer.
Aroma of roast, oat, ash, chocolate, honts of coffee and clean liquorice.
Flavours of roast, liquorice, wood roast, oat, nuts, bitters, some coffee and some raspberry tints.
Aftertaste is a mix of oat, roast, bitter, some rasperry ish tone, coffee and liquorice.
Low carbo, soft silky mouthfeel, medium to fuler bidy and a creamy light oily texture.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text:
The pitch black oily body is covered by a fluffy white head. Nose has notes of
coffee, rye, bisquits and chokolate. Taste is mildly sweet with a bitter undertone and a smooth dry finish. Carbonation is mild and the palate full and syrupy. Overall very nice, not too dry as is often the case with this style.
bottle 33 cl @ naamat. Pours black with a light brown head. Dark malts liquorice on the aroma. Dark malts, some milk in the flavour.

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2014 08.09.2013, 0,33l bottle @ home:
Nice brown creamy longlasting head. Aroma is slightly rich and sweet, dark malts, chocolate, caramel, coffee, toffee, licorice, nuts, hints of unripe banana. Taste is kind of unbalanced and all over the place, a little boozy, also a little "watery", dark malts, licorice, coffee, burnt caramel, grass, roasted grain. Mild longlasting bitterness. Nice, but Id say some aging would do this one good.

330ml bottle from Alko. Almost black colour, creamy light brown head. Very roasty aroma of herbs and coffee, somewhat sweet taste and nice herbal bitter finish, medium carbonation and very full body. The only awesome beer from them that Ive ever tasted.
Roasted malt, dark chocolate, dried fruits in aroma. Taste, roasted malt, dried berries, dark chocolate, coffee. Chocolatey finish. Dry and warming, although alcohol is dangerously hidden. Yummy.

Slightly burned toast, dark fruits in the aroma. Opaque motor oil dark, with a lively caramel dark head. Surprisingly no lacing on the glass. Balanced sweet malt, hop bitterness, salt and even notes of slight sour. Some metallic notes. Texture is thick, oily and slick. Moderate carbonation. This is an enjoyable porter with lots of complex flavor to be enjoyed sip by sip. Very pleased although this bottle was $4.99 US would purchase again.

On tap 4 oz. sampler at Pizza Paradiso in Alexandria, VA. 

Opaque, brown-black wiba tan head and good lacing. 

Aroma of sweet dark roasted malt, chocolate, brown sugar and molasses. 

Taste of chocolate, roasted coffee, roasted malt, molasses and very mild hops. 

Medium body and low/medium carbonization.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at the Blue Monk with Patty, Dan and Kara. Black body, moderate sized medium brown head, spotty lacing. Roasted malts, dark chocolate, roasted coffee, dark fruits, and earthy bitterness. Full to medium bodied, mellow carbonation, rich clean finish. A classic Baltic porter that shows off the style.

7.2% just 2.50 euros from Alko. A thick viscous pour and a thick luscious dark tan head. Kind of grassy aroma which doesnt impress me that much. The taste is way better! Smooth silly mouthfeel. Roast coffee & chocolate. Really good stuff & great value if you can find it. You dont taste the 7.2% at all. On second smell you do get some roasted malts but it is still s bit grainy. The taste remains wonderful, not super deep but satisfying. A go to porter if youre ever in Finland.

UPDATED: AUG 7, 2013 Appearance: beer is black and opaque, had a reddish hue when I was pouring it, has a relatively thin tan head, Aroma: very aromatic, syrup, molasses, coffee, bread, raisin, chocolate, Taste: coffee, some bitterness on the finish, raisin, Palate: soft carbonation, has a good froth to it, heavy mouthfeel Overall: a pretty good porter even though its not my favorite style, has a lot of complexity beneath the surface ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sinebrychoff Porter has a very thick, creamy, tan head and a dark brown, almost black, appearance, with thick lacing left behind. The aroma is of extremely rich, stinging malts, astringency, black cherries, licorice, black bread crust, and sour cream. The taste is of all those elements, with little bitterness and no alcohol showing up. Mouthfeel is thick and viscous, and Sinebrychoff Porter finishes dry, sweet, rich, and cake like. Overall, this is an outstanding imperial ale! RJT

The aroma is a strong roasty smell with chocolate that dominates. The color is black with a dark brown medium head. Cereal, chocolate, coffee and biscuit which is finely blended with a bit of bitterness. Excellent taste.

Pours pitch black with thick dark beige silky head. Aroma and taste brings to mind semi-sweet chocolate, lingering sweet bitterness on the palate. All around this is an excellent beer. Complex, smooth and drinkable.

Bottle from trade with rosenbergh, many thanks Jan Finally I can drink famous Finnish Porter. Almost black colored beer with medium quickly dissappearing beige head. Roasted malt, dark chocolate, dried fruits in aroma. Taste, roasted malt, dried berries, dark chocolate, coffee. Chocolatey finish. Dry and warming, although alcohol is dangerously hidden. Yummy.

[insert demented clown laugh] 33cl bottle - pours supa brown with a tone of brown head and great lacing. What the hell have stumbled upon from the clearance rack? Nose is of roasted toast and dark fruit. Flavor adds nuts, coffee grinds, and caramel. Awesome! so smooth, but yet full bodied. File under breakfast beer.
Delicious porter. Pours pitch black color with a nice brown head. Amazing burnt malts taste mixed with a bit of cocoa.
#boattasting Bottle. Black pour with some light head. Light roasted and toasted aromas. Flavor was roasted, mineral and light chocolate. A bit thinner than would have liked.
33cl bottle thanks to Miksu. Lovely dark color with medium head. Carbonation is very nice. Taste is very balanced. Aroma is coffee, chocolate, light fruit. Cool!

Crazy dark chocolate aroma, strongest Ive ever smelled. Thick chewy palate of chocolate and alcohol, but enjoyable. Also, strange hop character...kinda a green bottle funk/bitterness that doesnt compliment. The alcohol is slightly overpowering, which is strange for a 7% abv

Bottle. Black-dark brown. Thick medium brown foam. Roasted malt aroma, medium strong. 

Taste is a bit bitter. Malts, fruity hops, syrup. Surprisingly bittersweet with a malty body. Some carbonation feel. Good long bitter aftertaste. Alcohol is well hidden.

UPDATED: SEP 21, 2013 Black beer with a big brown head leaving lacing on the glass. Aroma has dark bread, dark chocolate, roasted malts and coffee. Taste is loafy malty, roasty, coffeey and chocolaty. Mouthfeel is thick, oily and hard. Surprisingly high carbonation. Nice amount of bitterness in the finish. A true Finnish beer classic. Not the most spectacular dark beer but a really solid effort and an excellent price to quality ratio.

Pours dark with a thin tan head.  Smell clings to the glass and hints at roasted malt, dried fruit.  It has a great mouth feel and its density grabs your attention.  Taste is roasted malt, sweet, with a pronounced fruit and garden taste prunes, jelly, hint of licorice. I was intrigued by the flavor. Have thought about it over the past few days.  I cant decide if Im a fan.  I dont think I could drink many of these back to back: cloying?  I want to take another run at it some time.

The aroma of this brew is quite subtle with only a hint of roasted malt making its way forward, but the color is an opaque black with no head. The taste has a backbone of a heavy umami flavor with a touch bitterness and a slight sweetness that dovetail nicely; furthermore, the palate combines an average carbonation, a medium body, a bitter finish, and a slick texture, resulting in a very enjoyable beer.
March 2010. Bottle. Licorice, roasted malt and coffee aromas. Pours black with a tan head. Medium carbonation. Flavors of tangy licorice, malt, and a little sweetness on the finish.

12 ounce bottle. Smells like campfire smoke, toasted sugar, dried fruit. Appearance is dark brown with a tan head. Taste is roasted nuts and molasses, anise, prunes, hint of licorice and bitter coffee.  Very drinkable for a baltic porter with so much flavor. Medium bodied, smooth. Overall, its a traditional Baltic porter thats well balanced and may set the benchmark for the style.

330ml bottle. Very dark brown colour, moderate cafe aux lait head. Looks like an Imperial stout. Chocolate, dark fruit and bread aromas. Tastes and feels a bit lighter than the looks would imply. Taste is bitter chocolate, coffee and earthiness, fruit isnt as much present as it was in the smell. Overall, very satisfying.

UPDATED: APR 24, 2013 Cola black beer with small mocha head. Dark bread, tobacco ash and roasted coffee in the aroma. Sweetness and off notes of cooked vegetables in the flavor. This isn?t right. I?ve had this many times before and this tastes bad. I must rate another one later. 

Edit: Trying another one. Clearly better!
Bottle into glass.  Black pour.  Strong stale european dark malt aroma.  Some sweetness at the end. Not seeing the big deal about this one.

Bottle. Very dark brown color, near black. Thin brown head. Aroma of salty licorice, hops, roasted malt and nuts. Bitter taste, sweet finish. Flavors are burned pancakes, roasted malt, hops and notes of nuts.

Pitch blach, good tan head.
Deep roasted aroma. Coffee, trecle. Also something solvent-like.
Taste suprises with its initial smoothess. Lots of roasted malt. 
Aftertaste has good bitterness.

Aroma: dark, yet mild smelling roasty aroma, mild chocolate, hint of soy sauce
Flavor: Chocolate and light savoury soy notes.
Comment:  On the nose there is a roasted aroma that is not distinctly coffee, chocolate or licorice.

Bottle at Eulogy. Oily black pour with a thick small bubble brown head. Thick and silky. Dark smoke on the nose. Chocolate. Coffee. Cinnamon. Cherry pits. Cigarettes. Charcoal. Nice thick body. Just enough smokiness in the mix to nicely balance things out.

The pour is motor oil thick oil with an awesome mocha head that quickly fades but leaves significant lacing.  The aroma is a happy medium between malt and roast.  The taste is primarily malt throughout until the bitter finish which really adds character to this beer!  This is good stuff!  Exceeded my expectations!!

0.33 l bottle from Alko. One of the two Finnish beers recommended by Michael Jackson, the late British beer expert not the pop star. Not my favourite though. Well, it is nice a imperial stout with taste of dark chocolate (bittersweet). Colour is black with brown head.

From a 33 cl bottle enjoyed in Key Largo FL.  Pours a inky black with a massive tan head.  Sweet roasted malt aroma.  Flavors include chocolate, coffee and licorice.  Silky smooth mouthfeel.  Some burnt bitterness in the finish.  Nice porter.

2006 bottle, Pours thick and black with no head.  The nose is briney, chocolate, coffee and cherries.  The taste is sweet yet still has a big bitterness.  I thought it would be gone after 7 years but nope.  The mouthfeel is smooth and creamy, body is heavy and finish is long.  Outstanding.

Bottle sample at a tasting at avrashis place. Thanks troubles and DSG. Pours black with a small tan head. Roast, raisins, faint wood aroma. Tastes a little dry, bitter and wooden. Medium body, roasty finish. Good.

Bottle from BW. Clear brown pour with a persistent short tan head which leaves moderate lace. Nose is licorice, chocolate and a hint of cinnamon. Medium body with moderate, fine carbonation. Body is quite smooth and round. Black licorice, baking chocolate, molasses and toffee. Finish is medium, semi-sweet, roasty and with a touch of umami which is almost woody. Love it, one of the best Baltic Porters Ive ever tasted, rivaling Smuttynoses BP.

I gave this one a high appearance rating for the solids layer of suds on the top and a dark complexion. Nice nutty aroma. Medium weight in the palate and subtle carbonation. Coffee taste and slightly bitter. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhoneEarlier Rating: 7/9/2011 Total Score: 3.6Had this at JRs in WhiPpany. And its great with my cigar.  Great nutty aroma. Excellent smoothness.

UPDATED: SEP 21, 2014 Re-rate 4/14: Bottle sample at a tasting at Beer Market Jaffa. Thanks tomer.  Black. Roast, smoke, chocolate, bittersweet, bitter finish. 7/4/8/3/15=3.7

Bottle shared at a tasting at avrashi?s place. Thanks oh6gdx for this bottle. Black with a light brown head. Nice roasty aroma with light smokiness, slightly meaty, some dark chocolate and cocoa. Roasty and slightly smoky flavor with a bit of coffee-ish notes, a bit of dark chocolate and a burnt bitter finish. Medium-full-bodied. A good one. 7/4/7/4/15=3.7

09.01.13. Bottle. Average size, brown foam. The beer is black. Aroma is a bit sweet, some smoke and malt. Taste is some bitterness and some roasted coffee. Surprisingly high carbonation, too much for me. Aftertaste is watery (a bit), some bitterness.For some reason I had a positive memory of this one. Certainly great for a Finnish mass-produced beer. However, it lacks the depth to compete with porters I have had. Great value for the Finnish market.

(33 cl Bottle). A unique find thanks to QuexXLV. Faint malt and roasted aroma. Rich and full flavored with nice roasted character, coffee but with some metallic notes. Authentic and traditional Baltic Porter. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

maybe not a fair review as I sampled this after Santas Little Helper. Cola color with quickly disappearing head, very carbonated, watery palate thin porter metallic notes 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Little dark head, smell has chocolate and hints of coffee. Strong taste, coffee and cocoa beans mainly. Colour is pitch black (maybe due bad lighting...), darkish coffee hop flavor.

Kaatuu lasiin sysimustana ja öljymäisenä, isokuplaisella vaahdolla. Haju on paahteinen, ruisleipäinen, kahvinen ja salmiakkinen. Maku on paahteisen ruisleipäisen kahvinen ja suklainen. Suutuntuma on täyteläinen ja maistuva. Kokonaisuutena tämä olut on yksi parhaita kotimaisia ja hinta-laatusuhteeltaan jopa monopolin paras. Kaveri on joskus sanonut, että tämä on kuin ruisleipää joisi, mikä pitää hyvin paikkansa.

Bottle to finish 4th qtr of patriots playoff game.  Pours dark brown with thin beige head.  Big nose of dark chocolates.  Tastes of high quality dark chocolate, earth, coffee, caramel, cola, vanilla, woody, and hoppy finish.  Great porter.Earlier Rating: 2/16/2012 Total Score: 3.5Bottle prior to Thursday poker game.  Pours jet black with small beige head and light lacing.  Small nose of cocoa and must.  Tastes of bitter chocolate, earth, light spruce, coffee, and smoke.  Slight chalky palate with good carbonation

Ar: Dark caramel, raisins, chocolate, and cherries - a bit of sherry, too.
Ap: Black and almost opaque, some very slight brown highlights on the edges - medium light mocha head with moderate retention and a thin but solid cap of foam.
T: Molasses, dark caramel, licorice, moderate sweetness up front - medium-low bitterness with a herbal flavor - lots of ash, a bit vinous - zesty currant and black pepper - full and robust malt backbone, that has deeply toasted quality - slight sherry flavor.
P: Medium-full body with high carbonation - finish is medium-dry.
O: A longtime favorite Baltic porter, one that introduced me to the style and continues to hold its own - the depth and complexity of this beer is world class, a must try for Baltic porter lovers.
330 ml bottle. Aroma rich and heavy, of dark malts and dark sugar. Tastes rich and full, dark malts and coffee. Surprisingly nice!

Black liquid, small mocha head. Aroma: nice mid dark chocolate, some nice creamy coffee notes, slight vanilla, sweetness and a little smokyness. Taste: Nice roasted note, some dark coffee, dark chocolate, maybe a little oaky actually, a slight tart cherry note. All in all pretty well made porter but not up there with the best.

Bottle. My Christmas tradition and best Finnish beer. Nice black colour with brown head. Well boiled hops aroma. Bitter, long taste. High carbonation. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Just perfect pint ! One Best Porters/Imperial Stouts ever made! @ Black Door Helsinki, Finland

Stopped regular rating 22nd Oct 2012 so this is one of my occasional ratings. This bottle very kindly passed on by Rune & Finn, at Kernel Brewery November 2012. Cheers Rune & Finn. Consumed Friday 14th December 2012   Pours very dark in fact it is surely black. Very roasty and with bitter cocoa showing, in fact this is really quite chocolaty but as stated already it is bitter dark, quality chocolate. Soft in the mouth, the head is mid brown, dry in the finish, a little salty liquorice but again it is the bitter cocoa that I keep coming back to. Quality beer, love this.   A7 A4 T8 P4 Ov16  3.9

Pours dark, opaque, appearance of coffee. Almost no head. Aroma of malts, molasses, maybe a little ash. Strong malt flavor, very bitter finish with a hint of molasses again. Very good, quite a competent porter.

Bottle @ Akkurat. Black colour with a tanned long-lasting head. Aroma of chocolate, dark fruit. Smooth full-bodied. Flavour of chocolate, grain malt. Didnt expect much from this, so it came as a big surprise. A very good baltic porter.

Bottle 33 cl from Drinks of the World - Bern (CH). Nice black colour, brown head rather tenacious. A delicious classic Porter, dry and creamy at the same time, very roasted, a little woody, full of coffee, plum and chocolate. It is fruity, not too heavy, rich with notes of charcoal and soft hop for the balance.

Nice porter. Chocolate and coffee dominate. Smidge of vanilla. More cocoa than chocolate.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Opaque black appearance with a large brown head. Strong chocolate aroma. The flavor is a mix of coffee and dark chocolate with a slight fruitiness.

Bottle shared at One Pint Pub.  Dark brown/black pour with a brown head.  Bg roasted malt aromas.  Bold in taste with a big body.  All kinds of dark roasted malts with undercurrents of coffee and 90% cacao.  Is this really a Baltic Porter??Earlier Rating: 8/6/2011 Total Score: 3.7Bottle.  Dark brown/black pour with off white head.  Roasted malt aromas.  Heavy dark roasted malts, burnt coffee, and woody notes..

Draft Oluthuone. Almost black with thick brown lipsticking lacing, lasting foam head. Aroma and taste are coffer, little chocolate, liquarish. But reasonable bitter taste. Aftertaste is mostly bitter. (Helsinki 201211)
