Bottle. Pours very dark with brown head. Tastes of roasted malts with some chocolate in it. Very nice!
33cl bottle. Beautiful dark almost black color with small intense head. Balanced, deep taste with hints of coffee and licorice. Long taste and very good brew overall.

Bottle thanks to Rune and Finn.  Drunk at home whilst watching jokes about camels.  Totally black beer with thick tan head.  Its a thickish beer. Some molasses some liquorice.  I prefer a more coffee and chocolate porter.  Its thick and quite tickley dry malty on the finish.  Some dryness.  Its a tasty thick porter.   Wow.  its really intense.

UPDATED: JUL 17, 2015 Pours black with a thick brown medium-sized, well lasting head. Aroma showcases strong roasty maltiness, coffee, dark chocolate and  some licorice. Taste is very malty and heavily roasty; notes of coffee and  chocolate feature most with some smoke and rye pudding appearing also. Fairly dry overall, not much sweetness. Definitely malt-driven but hops make a late cameo in the long aftertaste. Medium to full bodied palate with a velvety texture and a low carbonation. A great classic Finnish porter: rich, full and varied. Extra points for an extremely low price.

3 year old bottle. Pours an inky black with a steady schmeer of light brown foam. The aroma is rich dark chocolate, with traces of spice and a very faint sherry note. Tastewise, rich malty sweetness and a riot of chocolate and coffee fight it out and yet find balance with a subtle but firm hop bite. Full bodied, but not cloying. Very nice.

Pours black with a medium, thick dark tan head.  Aroma is dark chocolate, nutty, mocha and some floral qualities.  Taste is roasty bitters with sweetness coming through on the finish.  Some acidic/sour notes on the backend.  Medium bodied with a smooth and oily texture.  Soft carbonation.  Just a fantastic porter.

This is a heavy, big-character beer. First Baltic porter Ive had from the actual Baltic sea. Malt smells a little skunky with some roast. Aroma has lots of smokiness, some coffee. A little bit of caramel sweetness. Theres some bitterness in the end. Pretty low carbonation, and some alcohol. Not much head, some lacing. Pours black and red around the edges. Great mouthful of beer - epic palate. On tap at Blue Monk.
Pours black with a medium-high head. Big bubbles. Very common roasty aroma with hints of coffee and chocolate. Taste is mostly coffee and roasted malts. Slippery. Slightly hoppy after taste.

UPDATED: NOV 1, 2012 Draught. Black, tannish head. Nose is black malts, roasted, some syrupy notes. Body is fullish, quite dry actually. Some lager yeast flavors. A bit dusty hops. The bottled version is way better than this now. The intensity is somehow lost. And the smooth body. Will have to re-rate with a bottle soon.-- bb/h
Draught at Kittys, Helsinki. Dark black colour with very nice brown head. Aroma and flavour is coffee, chocolate and roasted malts. High quality beer with endless taste.
33cl bottle. Dark black with light brown head. Malty Smokey roasted aroma. Full bodied taste of coffee, chocolate, roasted malts. Balanced porter. Little hops at the end.

Bottle from Stellas in TC. Pours very black with a small eggshell ring around the glass. Nose of cocoa and roasted malts, perhaps some toast, and a decent dash of earthy hops. Pretty sweet but balanced by a sizable bitterness. Palate is slippery, not too heavy, with a lasting roasted cocoa bitter finish. A really nice dark beer that paired well with both wild game and rich dessert. Good stuff.

Black body, moderate sized medium brown head, spotty lacing.  Roasted malts, dark chocolate, roasted coffee, tobacco, dark fruits, and earthy bitterness.  Full to medium bodied, mellow carbonation, rich clean finish.  A classic Baltic porter that shows off the style.

Figs, roasted malts, hints of coffee and chocolate meet the nose. A black pour with a aggressive mostly diminishing tan head and moderate lacing. Taste is lightly sweet - dark fruit, figs, roasted malts, and hints of dark chocolate.  Medium-full bodied with soft carbonation and a smooth mouthfeel. Overall, an excellent porter. Want to drink again!

Into a snifter. Blackest black body with three fingers of tight tan head. Amazing looking.
Roasted malt, licorice and chocolate smell.
Taste starts slow and builds to a grand crescendo. Light taste, then black licorice, coffee, dark chocolate, biting bitter at the end.
High viscosity, almost sticky, low carbonation.
A definite winner in my book.
Bottle@ Gents Bierfestival. Black coloured beer with a small off white head. Roasted malty and herby hinted aroma. Full palate. Finish is roasted malty and slightly infected? Overall not bad.

Bottle. Pours opaque black with a medium brown head and nice lacing. Aroma is coffee, deep roasted malts, tar, raisin and smoke. Flavor is medium sweet with a medium bitter finish. Rich and full bodied, very complex beer. Quite nice.

Black colour, beige head. Aroma of roasted malts, quite sweet notes, coffee, chocolate and malts. Light sweet flavour. Light bitter, roasted malts. Quite light body. Finish roasted malts, coffee, cocoa with sweet notes
(Sample from 50cL bottle @ GBF3, Gent)

Bread, caramel, coffee, and chocolate in the aroma.  Flavor start sweet with some roast and smoke.  Bittersweet finish with coffee and chocolate.  Really smooth given the alcohol content, and just really good in general.

Dark brown, bordering on black. Nice mocha colored head. Two fingers. 
Earthy coffee, brown sugar. Good hoppy nose. 
Lots of earthy ground coffee in the taste. Lighter bodied but a solid feel. A lot like Old Rasputin in a lot of ways. Good beer

Tasted at 3de Gents Bierfestival.  Not sure what makes this a "baltic porter" other than the fact that its from Finland...its similar to a lot of other porters Ive had.  Pours black, with small tan head.  Medium-light taste, a lighter alternative to an ImpStout.  Quite bitter.  Well-brewed.

# 2 Finish beer at the moment // interesting - only one tick for Finland so far and it is a bad pale lager, so// 50 cl. bottle sampled @ GBF 2012  // lighter shade of black with a tanned head // smell is sweet, malt heavy, choc blended with some roasted malt and grounded and roasted coffee // tastes bitter, roasted malts, ground coffee, almost edging to a slight smoke with an underlying sweetness, lighter touch of fruits, touch burned, black chocolate and some hop adding bitterness to the finish // body is light touch too light for me // overall not a bad porter - seems like Carlsberg does make good beer

Opaque brown/black with a good brown head and a full lace coating.  This is porter the way porter is supposed to be: Burnt roasted caramel malt with a cleansing bitter at the finish.  The taste is big, the mouthfeel is big and rich, and there is none of the yuppie chocolate/coffee stuff going on (a nice change!).  Overall, a great porter, especially at 6.2%.  Hikghly recommended.Earlier Rating: 11/7/2011 Total Score: 3.6Dark brown/black with a dark head and good lacing.  Taste is strong roasted malt with a short burst of chocolate/coffee, followed by a long-lasting clean-the-palate finish.  Solid brew.

33cl bottle from Matias. Very dark brown with a generous creamy mocha head that settles down a bit and lasts for quite a while - very nice to look at. Nice roasted malt without overwhelming, light smoke and cocoa, medium roast coffee. Silky moderate carbonation, full body, hint of sweetness but quickly turns into a bittersweet chocolate taste (almost bakers chocolate) with a bit of alcohol and becomes very dry with a nice toast finish.

Old Finnish classic, considered by many the best beer in Finland. Indeed, it is very rich in flavour: smoky, bread-like, hint of chocolate and coffee. Full body, medium bitterness. Its a rich and complex porter, although if my memory serves right it was even better in the past: a strange vegetablish quality has recenty entered the mix.

UPDATED: APR 5, 2017 Bottle, 2000 vintage @ Toronado SF. Black color, very minimal beige head. Bitter/sweet taste with dark fruits, chocolate wood,, nuts and a bit of coffee and roasted malts. The carbonation is almost completely gone, really smooth body. Bitter finish with dark fruits, wood, chocolate, a bit of roasted malts and nuts. Still good, but past its prime definitely.

Bottle at bar. Black color, beige head. Strong roasty taste with chocolate, liquorice, coffee, plum and alcohol. Roasty, long-lasting finish. Excellent porter.

UPDATED: DEC 29, 2012 Very dense head dampens aromas. Smelling  is much easier once this is gone at least partly. Bit roasted and slightly sweet aroma has licorice and coffee, bit syrup and dark ripe fruits. Color is black, head is dense, light brown and quite long, leaves lacing also. Taste is dryer and more roasted than aroma, almost burnt, also bitterness here balancing, chocolate here is dark, black currant in flavor but not in aroma. Medium body, oily feel, long dry and roasted smooth finish. Lots of taste and character in this one, good balance. Quite roasted and dry. I enjoyed.
Black colored with dense white head. Smells chocolate and coffee, tastes a little sweet chocolate. Nicely balanced bitterness. Very good choice.

Pours a very dark brown color with a small head that quickly fades.  Rich chocolatey aroma to go with coffee and roasted malt.  Tastes delicious, very chocolately.  Slightly sweet, slightly bitter, nicely balanced.  Earthy hops come through in the very smooth chocolate finish.  A great porter.

11.2 OZ bottle.   Pours black with a brown, foamy, long lasting head and a lot of lacing.  Aroma is of toasted malt, bread crust, coffee, and hints of chocolate.  Body is medium and smooth.  Toasted malt, burnt grain, coffee, prunes and dark chocolate fill the mouth.  Finish is medium and slightly bitter.  Easy drinking porter.

Bottle @ The BeerMongers...  Poured near black with a thick, light brown head.  Nose had roast, cocoa, toasted grains and a faint hop character.  Mild body with a nutty roast, mocha, roasted grains, malt sweetness, worty tone, and a touch of hop flavors.  This was complex and drinkable, and an awesome price tag for sure.

Finally Ive got my hands on this  classic. Thanks a lot Rune, for the treat! Pours entirely black, coverd by a dense light brown cap of laceing head. Clean and rounded malt aroma featuring milk chocolate, mild coffee and hints of dark tinned fruits and ash. Creamy mouthfeel, medium body strenght. Taste is well roasted, yet rounded dark malts. More milk chocolate, notes of cold coffee, dark caramel. A light and refined sweetness and some balancing bittering hops underneath. A lovely beer,  top end Baltic Porter.
Nice porter, plenty of aroma and taste, but with very easy drinkability. Also come with a cheap price so my favourite beer if i want to get drunk. Brown tall head which looks delicious.

UPDATED: AUG 11, 2016 Black beer with a minimum head. Taste is toasty including coffee and chocolate. One of the best finnish beers.
Musta olut kohtalaisella, beigellä vaahdolla. Tuoksu paahteinen, kahvinen ja hieman salmiakkinen. Varsin täyteläinen suutuntuma, hieman hiilihappoja. Maku kuivahko, paahteisen kahvinen, suklainen ja loppupuoleltaan hieman humalan katkeroittama. Toimiva portteri

17/V/2012 - 33cl bottle @ Klaas place - BB: 23/XII/12 (2012-511) Thanks to Klaas for sharing the bottle!
Note: sampled for the Gents Bierfestival 2012, august 18th
Clear very dark brown beer, small aery beige head, unstable, non adhesive. Aroma: caramel, pretty sweet, floral, mocha, some banana. MF: good carbon, medium body. Taste: a lot of chocolate, cocoa powder, some coffee, some bitter hops, overripe fruits. Aftertaste: bitter hops, chocolate, little coffee, somewhat sour.

Growler from LaBodega. Dark brown with a small creamy tan head. Aroma of chocolate fudge, roasted coffee and light alcohol. Flavor is rich chocolate and bread, bitter roasted malt and a slight alcohol taste. Medium to full body with soft carbonation and a oily, slightly thin texture. This beer smells amazing, but the taste fell a bit short, still really great though.
thick black with one finger head. smokey with chocolate. rich roasted malt. quite good.

Very dark brown with a big head with good retention. Aromas of chocolate, light wood, light smoke. Flavors of chocolate, slight wood, light toffee behind the chocolate, slight caramel, and a hint of hops come through but barely. Milky, slight burnt malt aftertaste, lightly sweet, good stuff.
330ml bottle shared by FatPhil. Pitch black color, Small thick brown head. Roasted malts dominates the aroma, coffee. Thick oily, hazelnuts, coffee. Nice beer.

33cl bottle. Nice, light brown head. Black color. Decent lace. Nice, rich bigger body. Lighter, crisp carbonation. Very nice roasty aroma, but a hint of that metallic english malt aroma. Little chocolate. Light sweet and roasty taste. Definitely a quality porter.

I got minimal head on this. It pours wonderfully thick and had some great strong flavors to it. Taste like a porter on steroids - flavors are a bit amplified from your typical porter, but it has a really nice taste.

Originally reviewed: 1/4/09. Pours a thick motor oil-like black. This is the thickest and most syrup-like beer Ive ever poured. Pours a huge tan head that, as the previous post wrote, looks very much like a chocolate shake. Smells of sweet alcohol, chocolately tones, and some slight smokiness.

Very smooth and creamy brew. Im tasting some roasted characteristics, some definitive chocolate, with a pumpernickel bready finish. Very fine tasting beer. This is an exceptional brew. Recommend.
Bottle from Alko. Drank on finnish independence day 6.12.2011. Pitch black colour with dark brown head. Aroma is roasted malt. Flavour is chocolate, bitter finish.
poured jet black with a off white head.  smelled great, and of chocolate burnt malts and a little bit of sweetness.  tasted about the same good beer.
Bottle. Slight notes of chocolate and pear in the nose. Thin, translucent brown with little head, Mild metallic taste. Thin palate. A mild, more-or-less likeable porter, but a bit too watery
Bottle. Nose of rich chocolate, caramel, creamy, a bit of wood. Pretty head on black beer. Salty, wood flavor with umami and chocolate. Roast, complex, and good.

33cl bottle in a shaker.  Pours black with a fluffy, light tan head.  Aroma of roasted malts, some chocolate and coffee, plus a good amount of floral hops.  Flavor about the same, with a lot of malts, but a good bitterness to it.  Smooth texture.  A pretty good beer.
This porter pours dark black with a dark cream head. It has a nuty and partially sweet aroma and creamy texture with a lingering aftertaste. The long finish will leave you licking your lips.

Black with decent, creamy, brown head / Medium to full body, a little thin, chewy with some acidity, and with good balance and finish / Inky flavors of tobacco, molasses, dark roast coffee, smoke, and prune / Seems like a solid example of the style.

Chevy Chase, DC 330ml ($4.50): Pours a black colour with a quickly dissipating brown head. Aroma is smoke and burnts malts, with maybe a little bit of that creme brulee sugar. A think I noticed a touch of licorice too. Taste is solidly bitter towards the end and leaves a delightful burnt malt aftertaste in your mouth for quite a bit. Really smooth up at the front, but starts to get heavier down. Hops are noticeable. On one hand, this is easy drinking, but on the other hand it rewards measured sipping. I can see why this is rated so high.

33 cl bottle shared with gnoff on March 10, 2012.

Poured very dark brown with a brown head.  Smoke, mocha, roasted malt, vinegar tartness on the nose.  These same flavors carry into the taste, which also has some acidity.  Dry smoky bitter aftertaste.
Very deep and dark with a tan head. Thick with dark roasty malt flavor and a bit of cherry and raisin. Toasty but not burnt. Very smooth with a long lingering finish.

Bottle 330ml. Appearance: Oily black with lasting and beautiful dark brown head. Nose: roasted malt, ashtray (in positive sense) and coffee. Taste: More of the same in perfect harmony. Enjoyable palate lasts for ever.
My personal Gold Standard for a Porter.
Aroma of bitter dark chocolate, roast, and dark overripe fruit.  Pours black with a small tan head.  Taste is burnt marshmallow with a hint of coffee.  Very smokey and unexpected.  A hearty porter.

Black with a dark tan head.
Aroma is dark fruits, chocolate/coffee...smoke.
Taste is more dark fruit, creamy, roasted dark chocolate...pleasant bitter coffee bean.
Nice and full...Excellent.

33 cL bottle courtesy of tkrjukoff.  Cheers, Timo!  Pours obsidian black with a tan head.  Midnight black!  Nose is lots of dark fruit, slight roast, some mild coffee, and a hint of yeast.  Flavor is a burst of dark fruit up front followed by a bit of chocolate, finishing with some dark fruit and yeast among other flavors.  Medium in body and an interesting baltic porter overall; really surprised this is a Carlsberg beer...

330ml bottle. Pours thick and black with a nice looking big brown head. Aroma has some nuts, roasty malt, coffee and a hint of smoke. Taste has coffee, dark chocolate and roasty malt. Creamy mouthfeel. Medium bodied, oily palate, dry and soft carbonation. Slightly bitter with a long finish. The complex aroma and taste becomes stronger when the beer warms up a little bit. Superb price vs quality. A really good baltic porter.
Pitch black, medium hazel-nutty-brown head. Aroma is malty with a hint of caramel and espresso. Flavor is roasted malts, coffee, cherry chocolate and milk chocolate. Longlasting taste. Great beer!

A nice Batlic porter. Aroma was delicious. Strong milk chocolate, burnt malt and a slight dark cherry element as it warmed. Pour was a flat black with a thin tan ring for a head. Taste didnt carry through as strong as the aroma, but was still pretty good. The milk chocolate stayed but became an afterthought. Bitter roasted malt borderlined sour while a heavy black licorice note clung to the top of the mouth. Very dark tasting. Very bitter aftertaste that came more form the roasted malt and coffee flavors than the hops. Little to no carbonation in this beer but the flavor allowed me to overlook that.
user_location: Moon Twp, suburb of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA

text: 330ml bottle pours black in color with a finger of beige head that leaves some thin lacing on the glass.  Aroma is dark fruits and chocolate with hints of coffee.  Taste is quite sweet with malts and chocolate with a hint of coffee and a generous hop bitterness.  Heavy body and mild carbonation.  Alcohol is well hidden and flavors are nicely balanced.  I really enjoyed sipping on this one.

Bottle- Pours a black color with a big tan head that fades to lots of lacing.
 Aroma of roasted malt some coffee and hint of chocolate. Taste of coffee, roasted malt and bittersweet chocolate. It has sort of a coffee bitterness and a dry finish. Full body, smooth and creamy. No hint of the 7.2% ABV. Very enjoyable. Goes down easy. Nice late evening sipper.
Bottle 33 cl. Very black, large creamy brown head. Aroma is light malty and with notes of caramel. Coffee bitternes. Nice Baltic porter.

Called "Sinebrychoff Porter IV." Aroma of milk chocolate, malt balls (think Whoppers) light cherry, waffle cone and slight rum. Appearance is oily and black with frothy mocha head. Flavor matches the nose for the most part, with some additional roasted, nutty and nougat flavors. Palate is creamy with some light bubbles. A complex and satisfying Porter.

From notes: Philadelphia Beer Week draft @ Brauhaus Schmitz.  Poured deep brown-to-black with a small, dark tan head.  Chocolatey aroma with a nutty note and maybe some anise beneath.  Slight oily with a pleasing depth.  Sweet roasted malt taste with a nice chocolate note in the finish.  Few months later tried a bottle, with very similar results.
On tap at Toronado. Black with a creamy light brown head. Sweet milk chocolate covered cherry aroma and taste with a milk chocolate finish.

12/30/11. 11.2oz bottle labeled "Sinebrychoff Porter IV" thanks to watson1977! Luxurious dark pour with a nice thick brown head that cuts in half but lasts and even laces in chunks. Robust aroma of burnt coffee, cream, a bit of chocolate, and a touch of foreign stout sour fruitiness. Sweet milk chocolate entry that transitions to bold roasted malts with plenty of coffee and more fruitiness. The flavor lingers with a bit of dusty chocolate and a bit of metal. Not bad.

Pours like thick old motor oil. Opaque with a small Dark tan head. Aroma is faint but of malt. Has a bitterness from beginning to end mixed with chocolate and caramel flavors. A thick satisfying mouthfeel.

Pours a deep brown with riby hues...medium mocha head...nice lacing and retention.  Aroma has dark fruit...fig..., subtle dark chocolate, and a bit of toffee sweetness.  Flavor has nice roastiness, a hint of bitter dark chocolate, and just a touch of dark fruit...maybe a hint of tobacco.  Mouthfeel is medium and lively yet creamy with a bold, roasty finish.

Bottle shared at some place
Pours jet black, big espresso head. Smells of dark ripe fruits, coffee, yeast notes, smoke and roasted malts. Taste is full body malted, good sweetness, also coffee and caramell. Nice oily palate that leads to a nice bitter finish.

Bottle. Pours a dark brown, almost black color. Small thin dark brown head. Lovely malt aromas, roasty and coffee. Flavors of coffee, toasty bread, and toasted brown sugar. Malt finish is very pleasant, but strong alcohol on palate though. Overall I liked it as a winter beer.
pitch black color/ urnt coffee aroma/ flavor is sweet and slight unripe berry with some chocolate

Bottle.  Pours thick with a billowing tan head.  Aroma is whiskey, bready, coffee, chocolate.  Nice beginning, finishes with a burnt flavor that overpowers any other flavor.  Just a hint of metallic taste at the end.  This is a pretty thick and heavy beer.
Pours 10,000 mile dirty motor oil black with a tan head and excellent lacing.  Aroma of chocolate, toffee, and coffee.  Thin body with chocolate, toffee, and hints of milk.  All in all, a great beer!

This is my kind of beer.  12 oz bottle pours opaque black with a substantial head and lacing.  The first whiff smells like other Baltic Porters Ive tried, but the first sip is wonderfully chocolatey and smokey.  Texture is a bit oily, and the finish isnt very long, but Im glad to have tried this and will check it out again.  (Labeled as Sinebrychoff Porter IV)

Looks like coal tar. This is one of the darkest beers Ive seen in awhile Smells like semisweet dark chocolate melted over a simmering burner. Tastes of bittersweet toffee and strong roasted coffee. Distinct malty aftertaste. Not as thick as the appearance suggests, but oily residue abounds. Very nice beer indeed.
Bottle.  Deep black with a tall dark tan head.  Body is decent but a little thinner than I like for this style.  Strong flavor, lingering finish.

The first "best beer" Ive had.  Like drinking delicious motor oil.  Thick, creamy, with a dark brown head and opaque black coloration.  Chocolate, licorice, with a persistent sweetness.  Originally bought this at Wine 101 in Warrensburg, (10/10/2007) later found a bottle aged from 2000 in Lawrence.

330 ml bottle courtesy of tkrjukoff. Consumed on November 19. Pours deep brownish black with a brown head that quickly dissipates while leaving some trace on the glass. Smell is sweet with chocolate, vanilla and cognac. Taste is sweet and fullbodied with roasted malt, coffee, a slight tartness and slight bitterness. Finish is dry and bitter with lots of coffee.

330 ml bottle.  Pours deep black, the big chocolate coloured head makes it seem as though the beer is brown.  Aroma and taste are primarily bitter roasted malt.  Very smooth and no alcohol taste at all. Very drinkable!

bottle - pours a deep dark brown with a thin milk chocolate head. Aroma is dark chocolate, caramel, soy sauce, smoke, leather, and beefy. Taste is bitter smoky with a slightly bitter finish. Mouth feel is a bit dry. Overall, interesting, though not my favorite style.
Pours dark brown with a beautiful light brown foam that disappears. Aroma chocolate, bread, cereal. Strong palate. Not Bad.

Pours a very dark brown, almost black color.  Thick dark brown head present.  Aroma is of sweeter malts, caramel, toffee, chocolate, and some lactic.  Flavor is also of sweeter chocolate malts, a little lactic, slight coffee, and toffee.  Nice lacing with this one.  Leaves a nice roasty finish.  Perfect beer for a cold and crappy night like tonight.

12 oz. bottle. Pours pitch black with a thin brown head. The aroma is chocolate, toffee, toast, dates, and licorice. The flavor is very sweet and roasty, with a little bitterness in the finish. The palate is medium to heavy, sticky, and grainy. Overall, this is a well made and delicious porter, with strong flavor and pleasant aroma.
Bottle, black with dark tan foam, roasted malts and chocolate, tastes of the same with bitterness and light smokiness.

UPDATED: OCT 12, 2012 
Draught @ Salhojankadun pub.
Pours pitch black color with a small head. Aroma of liquorice, dark toasted malts, ripe fruits and chocolate notes. Flavour of dark chocolate, dark toasted malts and some fruits. Dry malty palate,dry finish. Bottle version is definitely better.
33 cl bottle.
Pours black colour with medium beige head. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, bitter tar, dark malts and some fruity notes. Flavour of roasted malts, light chocolate, coffee, light licorice and tar. Seems that the earliest batch Ive tasted has been the best, the latest have either some odd metallic flavour or the tar dry tar is just too dominating. Still this tastes rather good.
4424

pours an inky black with a tall dark beige head, some retention and lacing. nose and taste is raisins, soy sauce, coffee, licorice, chocolate, caramel sweetness and resinous hops. medium hopping - english hops. soft carbonation, light to medium body, medium long bitter, peppery finish.

UPDATED: JUL 31, 2015 Poured bottle into tulip glass from Goebel Liquors in Wichita, Kansas, USA. Marketed as Sinebrychoff Porter IV. Dark, dark, dark, opaque, reddish-brown with creamy, long-lasting beige foam. Extremely complex aromas and flavors: roasted barley, coffee, chocolate, fresh black-bread, raisins, currants, plums. Malty sweet. Balanced, but no extra hop presence. Very clean lager fermentation. Baltic Porter is one of my all-time favorite beer styles, and Sinebrychoff is one of the best Ive had. Not to be taken lightly, or drunk quickly, but an exquisite winter warmer.

Bottle. Moderate to heavy malt aromas of cereal, toasted, molasses and coffee, light to moderate hop and yeast notes of herbs, resin and earth with a hint of charcoal in the background. Head is average size, frothy, light brown with good lacing and is mostly diminishing. Color is very dark brown, almost black. Flavor starts lightly sweet, moderately to heavily acidic and a litle sour, then finishes lightly acidci and moderately to heavily bitter. Palate is medium, slightly creamy with a soft carbonation and a slightly chalky finish. Nice toasty aromas and some blunt flavors make this a unique Baltic Porter.
Another not sure as the site says "retired." Tap @ Green Leafe. I enjoyed this. Light bodied but full of roasty/smoky goodness. Aroma of toffee, coffee, and something sweet. Black with beige head.

My first beer from Finland. +++Sampled from an 11.2 oz brown bottle this beer poured pitch black and a bit oily with a huge foamy dark brown head that lingered and left great lacing. The aroma was dry, dusty and a bit roasty with hints of chocolate, coffee, wood and cream. The flavor was dry, bitter, woody and roasty with notes of smoke, vanilla, burnt toast and unsweetened coffee. The finish was long and roasty with lingering wood, smoke, burnt toast and coffee. Thick and creamy body. Nice.
Bottle. Pours black with two inches of khaki foam. Notes of chocolate and vanilla on the nose. Big bitterness on the tongue. A bit of roasting as well. This one tends to linger nicely.

Not going to lie, Im very biased towards this beer. This is the beer that started my craft beer experience. Pours of chocolate oil with no/thin chocolate brown head(cappuccino). Smells of chocolate/dark chocolate with a slight smokey hint. Its almost indescribable  the taste this beer has because I feel like god may strike me down for drinking such an awesome creation. Notes of chocolate, dark rich caramels, smokeyness and liqueur boozy Finnish*(did this on purpose). Awesome beer, perfect to drink in winter or cold months. TRY THIS BEER!
rye bread, earthy, black, brown foam, very bitter, light sweetness, full body, thick feel, average carbonation, bitter, long finish,

Serving: 330 ml. bottle from State Line Liquors.  It pours pretty much pitch black with a very dense head of brown foam.  The nose has lots of chocolate and roasted malt.  Maybe a pinch of dark fruit.  The flavor has lots of roasted notes and flint with a little coffee and dark fruit.  The chocolate from the nose is there but in the background.  This is one tasty brew.  Almost full bodied with softer than average carbonation leading to a medium to long roasty finish.  Outstanding from start to finish.

Almost black with a medium, big foamy head. A strong Burnt chocolate aroma with some roasted malt and hints of licorice. Roasted, lightly burned flavor with hints of licorice and coffee. Light to medium body, hardly any carbonation. Ok Porter, kinda thin, 1 dimensional. Another site says its retired?
Yet another domestic beer that really works. Almost pitch black and a rich taste.

0.33 Bottle Soft and sweet aroma, so dark color and rich foam when pours. Very balanced taste between sweet and hops. Palate is soft but still fills your mouth. Best thing is that balanced taste. Every one have to keep one of this in stock!
Bottle. Pitch black color. Smells of clove, vanilla, coconut and hazelnut cofee. . Lighter on the palate tehn it looks. Nice and thick with lots of complexity

33 cl bottle as Sinebrychoff Porter IV, BBE 18.06.2009. Rated on 30.4.2011
Tasted in a vertical with 8 different batches from years 2008-2011. This was the oldest and best bottle.Aroma is very close to a good IS. Lots of chocolate and roasted malt. Flavour has lots of chocolate too, but also hints of harsh, unpleasant bitterness can be observed. Very good baltic(?) porter anyway.
Pours coffee brown with a large brown head. Roasted coffee, raisins and sweet caramel in aroma. Flavor is caramel, roastiness and it has a nice bitter finish.

Pitch black with a half inch tan head. Good lacing up the glass. Beautiful aromatics show lots of cocoa and just a hint of orange. Full bodied with beautiful hoppy bitterness along with more mocha/coffee flavors. This is a beautiful beer. This manages to remain refreshing despite the weight on the body. Highly recommended!

11.2 oz bottle into English pint. My bottle reads "Sinebrychoff Porter IV." Pours opaque black with amber tints around the edges; has a large tan head that leaves spidery lace; takes forever to collapse. Aroma is grainy with a hint of maple syrup; has a bit of a SweeTart character, too. Taste is mostly sweet with a bitter edge. Roasty. Carbonation and body are medium, moutfeel is creamy. Nice.

Bottle 33 cl, Alko Arkadia, Helsinki. Pours lovely deep black with a huge brown fluffy head leaving nice lace. Aroma is fruity, roasted, malty, sweet, slightly vanilla, hay and coffee. Velvety lean medium mouthfeel. Flavor is acidy, sweet, malty, roasted, fruity, bitter and a bit dry. Very nice indeed. Medium fruity and bitter palate. Finishes slightly fruity and longlived bitter tart.

Danke an den Doppelbock für die Tauschabwicklung! Süßer, etwas kaffeeartiger Geruch. Cremiger Antrunk, ein süßer Unterton ist immer vorhanden. Von Anfang an ist das Bier röstmalzig, nähert sich gegen Ende hin auch einem Kaffeegeschmack. Ein herbes Aroma scheint nebenbei immer auf der Zunge zu liegen und ergänzt das Bier sehr gut. Weiterhin angenehm cremig. Köbes, noch eins! 	 
Test vom 4.2.2007, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 10,12,11,14,8,12 - 11,75

Bottle. Creamy lightbrown excellent fully lasting head. Black colour. Moderate malty and light hoppy aroma. Some chocolate and coffee notes. Moderate bitter flavor. Strong roast and coffee notes. Average moderate bitter finish. Creamy palate.
Pours a dark brown, almost black. The aroma is malty with notes of caramel, dark chocolate, smoke, raisins, molasses, and roasty coffee. The taste is much of the same. Enjoyable beer.

A jet black pour with a thin brown head.  It has a mildly sweet aroma with notes of caramel and slight bubblegum.  The medium body has an oily texture with lively carbonation.  The taste is mildly bitter with a very dry finish.
Bottle. Pours a dark brown with a tan head. Aroma has notes of coffee, roast malt, liquorice. Full bodied, rich and a oily palate.
Bottle. Huge head with good duration. Color is black. Aroma and taste are roast malt, chocolate, licorice and hops. Dry finish.
Pours pitch black with a dark brown head. Aroma is roasted malts, coffee and some chocolate. Flavor is mostly roasted malts with some coffee. Very strong in taste as porters should be. Superb.

Bouteille de 330ml achetée à Winooski et bue en compagnie de Patrick. Cest toujours agréable davoir la meilleure bière de Finlande sur la table. Cette bière est brune foncée, elle a des sédiments en suspension, la mousse brune crémeuse et durable. Le nez est dune belle complexité où les effluves de chocolat, de pain grillé et de caramel se battent pour se faire sentir. La bouche est digeste, lalcool est peu ou même pas présent, le corps est mince (levure lager?) le caramel domine les goûts de torréfaction fort agréable.

Le liquide a une robe presque noire.  Le col mousseux brun est bien épais et persistant.  Une dentelle séparpille tout autour du verre.  Au nez, la torréfaction est légère et sait bien sentourer de caramel et de chocolat.  Lalcool est peu intense mais chatouille les narines.  Le goût développe des saveurs davantage rôtis avec un caramel amplifié et un chocolat légèrement diminué.  Peut-être même quelques fruits qui saccrochent aux papilles.  En bouche, le liquide a un corps moyennement charpenté avec une effervescence qui me semble modérée et une texture douce, voire crémeuse.  La finale se fait sur des notes amères de torréfaction justement touchées par une douceur chocolatée.  Très bonne dégustation offerte par Yan.  Merci!
Bottle at Villi Waino, Helsinki.  Pours black with dark head.  Sweet with chocolate and slightly burnt coffee flavors.  A good beer, but I think there are better Finnish porters than this.

bottle, from trade with the beer god. Ok aroma, earthy, viney, little cobweb thing going on. Blacking brown color, good head, spotty lace, bitter flavor, lite body, thin smmoth mouthfeel, bitter finish. Another in the held on to too long collection, held up well for age, but was weak in taste.
user_location: the Containment Area, North Carolina, USA

text: Dark chocolate and dark malts in the aroma, the taste doesnt have the typical porter or even stout characteristics.  It tastes very much of dark malt and a little bit of chocolate, without the porter or stout bite to it.  A little different, but excellent none the less.

Apperance:  very dark brown with a tan, creamy head that lingered and left good lacing.   Aroma: 	bitter chocolate and coffee; toasted oaty grains.   Taste: 	toasted smoky oats up front, with malts and smooth, dark, bitter chocolate; a little sweet.   Finish: short, dry and surprisingly crisp.   Notes: 	Unusually gulpable for a porter, although the flavors will encourage you to sip.  Good solid flavors; not too complex.  Tasty.  The surprising and easy finish really made this a nice one.
thin frothy head. very black. burnt chocolate aroma. light to med body with an almost creamy texture. soft carbonation w/ an astringent finish. i think it tastes like crushed coffee beans. nice.

The beer is black with a medium tan head. 2 fingers of head with great retention and lacing. This head fell for at least 10 minutes. Even then there is still a nice soapy head.

The aroma is light with roasted chocolate and coffee dominating.

The taste is also light with the same flavors you get in the aroma shing through. There is a nice chocolate finish that makes it easy to drink and gives it a nice heavy feel.

Bottle/11.2oz - Pours an oily dark black/brown in color with a medium dark tan head that settled to a thin covering over the beer and produced some nice lacing on the glass.  Aroma is most dark malts and some grassy hops along with just a hint of chocolate.  Flavor is roasty with some chocolate.  Slightly metallic in the finish, but does not detract significantly from the quality of this beer.  Decent palate.  I love it when my first beer from a new country is a good one!

UPDATED: APR 23, 2013 03122011: Sip from a bottle used as a base for oxtail stew. Nothing wrong with this. Pours a gorgeus dark brown with a large, mocha-colored head. Aroma is coffee, chocolate, roasted malts. Taste is much of the same. Palate is full. Just excellent.

06032011: 330ml bottle. Pours a very dark brown, almost black, and oily. A very large head (comes out of the English pint I poured it in) the color of beige that also leaves a lot of lacing. Ive had this numerous times before, but this time the aroma is wrong. It is metallic, soapy with a hint of chocolate. Never had this before. Fortunately the taste is more or less correct though: Roasted malts, liquorice, coffee, a little bit of chocolate and salty liquorice. Mostly the first two. Palate is alright, not too light perhaps a bit too much carbonation. A poor bottle/batch this one? Hopefully next one is better again.
Strong coffee, some chocolate, some bread. Not too much of anything. Medium sweetness, lightly sour. Little fizzy and lively, long finish.

330ml bottle @ Keltsu, Espoo

Pours black with a nice foamy head. Aroma is metallic and roasty. Smooth, milky taste with a roasty and chocolatey finish. Well balanced and medium bodied porter. Easy to drink.

UPDATED: SEP 7, 2013 Koffin porteria on tullut maisteltua jos se toinenkin kerta. Ruskea vaahto on viehättävän näköinen ja itse olut on hyvin tummaa, lähestulkoon pikimustaa. Tämän porterin aromissa on runsaasti paahtunutta mallasta, kahvia ja hieman suklaata. Maussa on paljon kahvia, paahtunutta mallasta ja hieman karamellista makeuttakin. Humalointikin tuntuu maussa selkeänä katkeruutena. Virheitä tästä on vaikea löytää. Sinebrychoffin porter on edelleen hyvää, mutta oli aikoinaan tuntuvasti halvempaa ja ainakin etiketissä olevan reseptin mukaan ilman tärkkelystä. Eipä ihmekään, jos olen huomannut maun hieman huononneen vuosien mittaan. Näin lopuksi voin todeta, että oluen suutuntuma on edelleen miellyttävä ja runsaan öljyinen.
Good head retention, Thick oily body, roasted malts shine through, robust aromas of roasted malts, a Mans baltic porter, highly recommended

UPDATED: APR 1, 2015 A 33 cl bottle poured into a glass. Black beer forms a thin wheat coloured head. Aroma: Roasted malt, root cellar, earth, carrots. Taste: Lightly sweet and roasted bitter taste. Palate: Almost full bodied beer, smooth creamy texture with soft carbonation. Long dry roasted lightly bitter finish. Overall: Excellent porter. 2.12.2011/19.9.2013, 7/4/7/4/16

Re-review: 12.2.2015:
33 cl, bottled. Pours beautiful dark black with a decent tanned head. Aroma: Toasted malt, bread, old cellar, potatoes. Very pleasant mild earthy flavours. Taste: Medium sweet, medium noticeable bitterness and some notable carbonation. It is solid. (same score)

Re-re-review (1.4.2015). Ok its amazing. Its amazing porter no denying that +3, +1 aroma, + 1 taste overall. I have been buying this stuff lately very much, its excellent late spring, winter, early spring beer..

"Now thats a black beer!" - My friend

Pours a pitch black with a nice foamy caramel/tan colored head. The head glistens almost like shiny sand. It gives way to healthy lumps of lacing.

This one is bold on scent. It leans heavily on heavy dark choloclate, with some sweet roasted malt on the side. A tiny bit of dark dried fruit is in there too.

Its full bodied but it has almost a slippery mouthfeel as it seems like the stuff just slides merrily across your tongue and then down your throat. Tastes like chocolate espresso. Has a nice lactic/milk sour twang as well. Its malt, malt, and more malt, very tasty.

Overall a great Baltic porter, a style which I really appreciate, and this one is well near the top of my rankings for Baltic porters.

Bottle @ home.  Pitch black appearance with a dark brown head that disappears pretty quickly.  Roasted chocolate malty and quite nose.  Milky, smooth mouthfeel.  Dark roasted chocolate flavor thats a bit milky and creamy.  The roasty flavor comes through nicely on the finish and lingers somewhat afterwards.  Good Baltic Porter.

Bottles bought at Alco in Mariehamn! Rating dissapered!
Great stuff, but a bit thin flavor wise!
Pours solid black with a cream light brown head. Aroma of roast malts and milky sweetness. Taste is very rich, lots of malt, bitter chocolate finish. Smooth texture, soft carbonation. Great beer.

starting to appreciate the coffee and raisin flavors of porter. this seemed to be a good authentic baltic porter, and it didnt dissapoint. first taste is of dark fruit, but as the taste lingers, the extreme bitterness kicks in. very enjoyable, and one that im looking forward to appreciating even more now.

UPDATED: APR 15, 2011 Christmas gift from Nordcore:
Appearance: Very dark brown, basically black. Dark tan head.
Aroma: Dark malt, roasted. Coffee. Burnt caramel, prunes.
Taste: Dark malt, chocolate. Roasted, coffee.
Info: 330ml bottle, 25/12-2010, 212/300, 225/500

Shared bottle. Black body with a two finger thick creamy head leaving a very good lacing. Wood, roasted, coffee, chocolate and flowers fills the nose. In the mouth milk chocolate, roasted malts and oysters notes are added to the aroma along with sweet, bitter and acidic flavors. Smooth to drink, the body is medium to full. Nice one.
Bottle 33 cl. Poured black colour with brownish head. Aroma is coffee, roasted malt,  chocolate  and dark fruit. Flavour is roasted coffee, espresso and light smokiness. Great porter.

Bottle pours black and translucent with thick tan head.  Aroma roasted malts.  taste roasted/burnt malts, a bit of chocolate and licorice. Medium-thick palate with medium carbonation.  Finish roast.  
Good straightforward Baltic porter but it could have used something to give it a little more flavor and make it a bit more interesting.
One of the best finnish beers and surely the best beer made by any big finnish brewery.
Bottled. Very dark color with nice beige head. Aroma is packed with chocolate, roasted malts and coffee. Nice warming finish. This is probably the best Finland has to offer in terms of beer.

pours dark brown with a thin head of brown that lasts all the way to the end. standard cocoa powder nose  light mouthfeel that has a bit of fruit flavor at first sip. expected sweet chocolate. finishes with chocolate raisin flavor. an easy to drink higher abv porter. good for the cold noights that are setting in

Sample from bottle at JaBiers house. Pours black with brown head. Aroma is dark fruit, licorice, slightly roasty. Flavor is lightly roasty with notes of coffee, bitter chocolate, light to medium mouthfeel

Poured black with a thick tan head.  Aroma has lots of caramel and chocolate with some nuts and bourbon.  Taste is slightly watery with chocolate malts and nuts.  Slightly creamy with some wooden characteristics.  Finish is bitter with chocolate, and dark fruits.  Overall pretty good, but nothing too amazing.

The head is rather full but dissappates quickly leaving some attractive lacing behind.  The nose is actually a bit delicate offering aromas of bitter roast and dark fruits like dates.  Loads of bitter roasted malts, dates, and chocolate covered raisins.  The mouthfeel is a bit thin, but fits the beer well.  The finish has a nice bitter end.

Färgmässig är den som den ska vara, vätskan kunde varit en aning tjockare.
Doften: Malt, choklad och kanske en liten gnutta vanilj.
Smaken: Lite tunn tyvärr, men mörk choklad och kola tyckte jag hitta.

dark brown, good looking tan head, quite lacy.  nose is roasty malt, coffee and chocolate.  flavor if roasty, chocolatey, with a fruity note and a trace of hops.  full bodied, oily mouth feel, sweet finish.  quite an enjoyable porter.

12oz bottle as Sinebrychoff Porter IV.

Appearance : Pitch black with big brown creamy head. Nice head colour. Great lacing.

Aroma : Strong roasted malt along with coffee and black chocolate notes. Light caramel. Some hops. Light fruits.

Taste : Nice roasted malt with some hops. Awesome roasted finish along with dry notes of chocolate. Very clean beer. It had light hints of butterscotch at first but it all cleared up. Finish is a bit woody.

Overall : Very clean beer. Very drinkable. Soft carbonation but it doesnt feel flat. Nice body. Awesome finish. Very good after heating up a bit and breathing.

330 ml bottle. Rated multiple times.
Pours a dark brown colour with a beautiful brown head. Lacy. Aroma of roasted malts and most importantly, chocolate. Flavour of roasted malts, mild caramel and lots of chocolate and dark coffee [1]. Full bodied, oily texture. Very good.

[1] Vegetables sometimes, if its a bad batch.

Bottle, Marian Helmi Bar, Helsinki. My first Finnish beer of the trip and the highest rated beer on here seemed like a good enough place to kick off proceedings. Near enough black pour which seemed to mirror the mood of the barmaid nicely, with a dark brown head. Rich roasty nose with notes of molasses. Flavour was roasted malt aplenty and had a burnt character and traces of dark chocolate and coffee. Pleasingly lingering finish. Great balance here and if this beer was a footballer I guess hed be Jari Litmanen....
Very nice. Dark and creamy malty chocolaty and molasses. Nicely balanced.  Serving: Bottle

Pours a deep dark rich mahogany with a small brown head. Aroma of dark malts, caramel, coffee, chocolate, dried fruit. Taste is same as aroma. Palate is full body,very nice smooth and creamy texture, good carbonation. Finish is creamy, chocolate, coffee, dark fruits and caramel, a touch of licorice, with some light bitter hops to add some balance. Overall a very nice and smooth BP. Very tasty and enjoyable.

Dark brown/black color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of toasted malt, chocolate, & coffee; Flavor of roasted sweet malt, espresso, caramel, molasses, hops, and some licorice; Finish is slightly bitter; Nicely balanced; Very good porter overall.

Pours a dark black color with a thick caramel colored head.  Has an aroma of molasses, dark fruit, with hints of chocolate.  Has a nice creamy mouthfeel.  Roasty and bitter with a nice velvety chocolate finish.  Some dark fruit notes on the finish as well.  Not overly complex.  The creaminess is the highlight, but nothing special here.

33cl bottle, Alko. Pours black color with a thin dark head. Nice aroma of espresso, leather and roasted malt. Flavor is roasted malt, some liquirice and cocoa. Dry bitter finish. Just an excellent porter.

330ml bottle at rating session in Tromsø 27.Oct.2009. Creamy head. Black body and light brown head. Chocolate, prune and vanilla aroma. Creamy, with taste of bitter chocolate and roasted pine nuts, coffee and tar. A bit metallic finish. Thanks to Rune for sharing!

Bottle at Dempseys. Pours like motor oil, shiny and black, with a sizeable, firm beige head. Lots of roasted malts and dark chocolate in the aroma. Flavor was somewhat sweet, but the bitter chocolate, almost like baking cocoa, held things in check. Full bodied, chewy, with fine, soft carbonation. Lingering roasty dryness. Excellent.

Pours a two finger brown head that fades quickly to a thin layer leaving some lace. Light carbonation and Heavy bodied.  Black color, no highlights, some yeast left in bottle.  Nose is molasses.  Flavor is chewy molasses, nice porter.  Less chocolate and more molasses than 8 years ago. $4.45 for a 330ml bottle from Colonial Spirits, Acton, MA.

Dark brown with hint of red, almost still look like cask, texture fine carbonation and full feel - a bit pleasantly sticky. Taste is frontal roast and light smoke with a great sour note of lactic and coca. Taste Mocha and dry pale fruit, apple, lemon, and the light tartness is brilliant against the malt richness. Late finish of smoke, chocolate and lemon. Aroma of coffee dark berry lemon and fine leather.

Standard coffee / chocolate / smoke aroma.  Dark brown / black and opaque.  Tall tan head, retreats quickly.  Flavor is surprisingly light.  Flavors follow the aroma, but are weak by comparison.  The aroma suggests a much more assertive flavor profile.  Medium body and low carbonation.  Fizzy mouthfeel.  Dry finish.  Middle of the road.
Very nice black pour with thick head. Nose and taste is pretty standard chocolates, malts and breads. Dryish finish. Rated 11/17/2000

33cL bottle.  Pours dark brown, looks black, with a medium foamy brown head.  Aroma is rich malt, toffee, caramel, brown sugar, and oats.  Flavor is sugar cane, coffee, vanilla, and a bitter mocha and grassy hop finish.  Creamy mouthfeel with low carbonation and a dry finish.  I thought this was great.

Pours a dark black color with a very creamy, deep tan head that sticks to the side of the glass after each drink. The brew has a very rich aroma. Strong caramel and chocolate nose, mild licorice, fig and woody notes come through as it warms up and a mildly hot alcohol kick rounds it out at the end. Flavor has a strong chocolate and fig sweetness up front followed by a caramel and roasted malt note. A sharp Merlot wine flavor hits as the end with some noble hops like bitterness . Body is very dense and has a hefty sugary feeling with a nice roasted malt acidic bite. Overall a very nice example of the style. Rich aromas and flavors really work well together and create a rich Merlot flavored brew.

Pours nearly black with a tan head that doesnt last long, leaving minimal lacings. Got a subtle complexity. Some dark fruits, a sort of lactic sweetness, milk chocolate, light coffee, bourbon and alcohol. Dry, balanced taste. Low carbonation and a smooth, oily mouthfeel. Well held together.

33 cl bottle. Fortune cookies, biscuits, dark grains, light bourbon, vanilla beans, earth, minor soy, sweet berry fruit and chocolate toffee candies. A subtly complex aroma makes this one intriguing from the start. With the pour, a big fluffy deep cream head, dark mahogany brown color, and thicker, mostly opaque body.  The taste of this one, thankful, goes along well with the aroma. Malt dominated, though not overly sweet in the least. A backing, very evident yet non-distinct earthy hop does a nice job in balancing. Malt components to this one are dark cereal grains, biscuits, berry fruits, minor bourbon, toffee, chocolate, and a hint of soy. The body of the beer could have been slightly livelier, but still nicely drinkable at 7% abv. An enjoyable beer through and through.

Poured into an almost black color, with a strong ring around the glass. Smellled of sweet and nutty caramel with chocolate mocha undertones, and another smell that I usually notice in scocth ales but I cant put my finger on it. The taste was big with a dry malty flavor being most pronounced mixed in with a slightly spicy or bitter hoppiness and a bit of smoke.

Bottle from the Kamppi Alco I reckon. Black body, slightly tnged with red. Tan head that stood there for awhille. Strong sweet malty nose, coffee, slightly oily. Soft coffee taste, some chocolate. Creamy, very nice overall even if its not all that flashy.
Bottle. Shared with tarheels. Pours pitch black with a tan head. Flavor is chocolate/coffee with a salty/oily mouthfeel. I thought it was gross.

Bottle. Pours nearly jet black with a thick, rocky deep brown head. Good retention. No lace. Aroma is big raisin, figs, dates, some raw maltiness. Taste is saltwater, flat cola, raisins. Not too much body. Sort of an oily palate. Would do well as an oyster stout. A nice surprise!

Bought in Sept 09 at Knightly, drank 3/09/10 at 8:28pm .. . huge head, cocoa on steroids.. . come clean you bearded phony! .. .Sweet dirty molasses, expired maple syrup, and seared Guinness flavours ..  Jabahcheapskate .. Aged for a few years, has done nicely .. i wish i could eat cat food, spoiled brats .. . A very nice brew .. and a shout out to Ziggy from CCA in Houston, and to my boy Douglas Rainey, called me Big Show, you know! .. . This would be amazing on cask!

Very interesting porter...33cL bottle pours a deep opaque black/brown with a nice bubbly tan head that leaves great windowpane lacing.  Aroma is a strong cocoa and medium-roast coffee.  Flavors are similar, but with a nutty roasted coffee flavor taking center stage.  Fairly smooth with just a bit of an oily nature.

Pours nearly opaque black with brown head.  Nose has some dark chocolate and dark rum aromas.  On the palate the roasty flavors dominate, with a lot of malt sweetness with chocolate and coffee.  Finish is full of coffee flavors.  Alcohol is tame on the palate, even though it has a high ABV.

Draft at Uber Tavern.  Black pour with a moderate beige head on it.  Aroma is chocolate, coffee, sweet dried cherry.  Flavor is a touch of dry chocolate, a bit of a nutty/lactic quality around the midpalate, more dried cherry, and a dry, fairly bitter espresso finish.  Has a moderately rich feel to it, somewhat creamy.

UPDATED: MAR 14, 2010 33cl bottle. Poured a oily black with a thin brown head. Aroma of licorice, dark chocolate, something almost like olives and earthy. The taste was much the same... could not taste any alcohol. This one leaves a oily feel in the mouth... no bitterness. The body was medium to thin. Overall good: I thought it had something unique about it... with that said it was not really my thing... but glad I tried it.

Courtesy of Finn. Bottle. High creamy and lasting light brown head leaving nice long lacings. Pitch black body. Dusty coffee cocoa aroma. Mild creamy coffee liquorice flavor with low carbonation and a long aftertaste. Alcohol well hidden and seems just right. Nice surprise.

Bottle from OTM. Pours a rich and creamy chocolate brown with a nice medium cream brown head. The aromas are rich with deep roasted malt, bakers chocolate, milk chocolate. The flavors follow the full roasted profile, nice bakers chocolate, a touch or two of anise, some nut shell, hard candies. Mouth is full bodied with a good carbonation to it. A nice Baltic!

Pours black with large rocky, tan head; sweet aroma of molasses, toasted caramel and brown sugar; medium to full body, smooth texture; flavor of roasted barley and bitterness with sweet toffee notes; burnt finish and aftertaste. The aroma doesn´t really match with the taste nor is it the strong point of the beer otherwise, but still this is a great baltic porter and besides Winter War and the ice hockey world championship 1995 one of the few things the people in Finland can be proud of.

Pours dark, dark black with a brown head which dissipates but gathers in the middle of the glass, a little lacing present. There is a lactic acid twang in the nose with dark chocolate and roasted malt. The palate is full bodied, slick, soft and pillow-like. There is a malty sweetness in the taste which finishes with the lasting flavor of lactose and semi-sweet chocolate. This is a rich and inviting Porter. Great for sipping. Unique.

Bottle. Pours black with brown head and good lacing. Full bodied with average carbonation and long, lightly bitter and burnt finish. Robust aromas have coffee flavors, roasted malts, hint of chocolate.
Black, viscous pour, aroma of fruit and dark roasty goodness. Heavy in the mouth, almost a stout but still not as chewy, with sour fruit and a lasting tang.

Draught, Dunedin House of Beer, Dunedin, FL: Well, this is one of those great moments to be a beer geek. Stumbled into a bar as my wife shopped next door and asked for something dark and tasty, this is what I was given. The pour was black, ruby edges, a big and thick tan head. Aroma is sour cherries, roasted malts and molasses, just a solid scent overall. The taste is insane with a great sour cherry flavour alongside roasty malts, chocolate, lactose and molasses. All a little light to sip, as a porter should be. Great stuff!

12 oz. bottle from Jungle Jims.  I was surprised to see the percentile on here, as I just bought it seeing that it was from Finland and looking to put another country on my map.  Pours black, almost motor oil in appearance out of the bottle, with a huge, rocky tan head that leaves soapy lacing all over the glass.  A lot of chocolate malts on the nose, with notes of dark fruit, tobacco, dust, cardboard, and burnt sugar.  The flavor is more smoothed out than the aroma indicates, with notes of chocolate malts, roast, brown sugar, light hops, and dark fruits late.  Lighter body than the appearance lets on, with an thin, oily mouthfeel.  Roasty, fruity finish.  Not a bad porter, but certainly overrated.

Thanks Fatphil for the The tip! Dark color with a short beige head, aroma is coffee and some roasted malt. Flavor has notes of chocolate, roasted malt and some good bitterness. Mouthfeel is quite long and bitter coffee. Good one.

Dark black tan head pour smokey chocolate nutty malt aroma dark fruits taste of caramel nuts licorice roasted chocolate smoked taste .... light bitter finish this stuff is sessionable and medium bodied an amazing porter lots of flavor dont pass this one up
Bottle. Dark brown color. Nice smoky aroma. Flavor of roasted malt at the beginning, then some hoppy tones. Good smoky finish.

Black pour with a frothy boisterous tan head. Aroma is massive milk chocolate, coffee, earth,  and cream. The flavor is super creamy with hints of roasted barley, bitter bakers chocolate, and dark roast espresso. The palate is velvety, silky and creamy with a lasting roasty finish. Super tasty.

Tap @ Ebenezers. black pour, beautiful brown head. aroma holds lots of chocolate and coffee, some cream, and a nice note of earthy manure as well. flavor is delicious; roasted malt, coffee, espresso, bitter chocolate. Nice mouthfeel, just a damn good porter.

Jet black pour with an off white head. Aroma is sweet with robust roasted malts, cream and coffee. Flavor is big bold, roasted malts, creamy coffee, sugar, chocolate and toffee. Really nice and delicious.

Bottle courtesy of ditmiers return box from the perfect 10v4 trade.  Pours a deep viscous dark black with a dense dark brown head.  Beautiful.  Deep dark plum and roast with some bitter cocoa.  Almost thick mouthfeel, touch of sweetness, light chocolate.  Simple but tasty.  Finishes with some deep bitter cocoa with an earthy smoky quality.  This is quite delicious.

Bottle. Been looking forward to trying this one out. Pours like a big stout, not a porter - opaque black and a big foamy brown head. Aroma is big and malty - fruit and chocolate notes, tobacco, and a little booze. The flavor is much more subdued, though, with a sweet malt layer carrying along some roast and minimal hop flavors. Palate is just a little thinner than Id like. I spent some time with this porter, trying to figure it out. It has an particular character that I cant quite define. Its not the biggest or most complex porter, but its certainly an interesting one to drink. Take your time with it, too - I came to enjoy it more as it continued to warm a bit.

UPDATED: DEC 11, 2011 opq-bk, foamy tan head, wavy lace, med-full body, ^co2.

aroma: sweet licorice alchl silo earthy-hop.

dark-malts §lcrc §alchl T1, §sweet roasted-chclt-malt T2, burnt(but not chrcl) T3.
big swig yields mtllc-hop flavor, complex but rounded, ^drinkable, sessional.

dark red-brown with oily head. Crisp aroma  of hop, yeast, toast, a little banana. a porter with saison notes. Taste is very dry. smoke, bitter hop. some sour mineral flavors. Kinda burnt flavor. a little flat.
smokey. a little thin and watery. this is something i could drink again, but i wouldnt seek it out. pretty decent.
Bottle. Aroma is rasin, fruity, malty. Apperance, Dark brown. Taste, malty like a porter except a slightly stronger alcohol taste. Good.

Fantastic aromatics full of cocoa, wet tobacco, port wine and oatmeal. The scent is inviting and very robust. Rich brown body, lasting brown head, and thick lacing. Medium bodied, lightly creamy with a lingering bitterness. Nutty, woody malts with some burnt flavors. Chocolates and mild coffee coupled by a mixture of dark berries. Well hopped and enjoyable.
2nd August 2008. Silky porter. Typical porter tang and a distinct undertone of coffee. Also some minerals riding alongside.

33 cl bottle.  Pours a dense black with a large, luscious, bubbly deep brown head that lasted through two-thirds of the glass and left substantial lace.  This is a porter? Most stouts strive to look this good!  Very pleasant aroma of roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, raisins and plums.  Very flavorful as well, although the fruit that is present in the aroma does not come through in the flavor, which is roasted malt, bittersweet chocolate, and a bit of ash.  Full bodied with a somewhat dry finish.  An excellent porter.

330 ml bottle. Black body with a nice beige head. Aroma has roasted malt and coffee. Flavor is Mild burnt malt, roasted coffee and a hint of chocolate. Nice, balanced and rather pleasant without being to sharp in any directions.
TAP: thick black pour, minimal head. Mild nose with some roasted malts, taste of dark fruit, coffee, and easy drinking. Awesome stuff.

Bottle. Very dark brown / black beer with a beautiful beige head. Aroma is roasted malts and dark chocolate. Flavor has got the same with a nice bitter end. This is a true Finnish classic and costs under 2e bottle. Better not drink this too cold!

Bottle at K&L.   Black with a frothy tan head.   The aroma was strongly evocative of dried fruits such as dates and prunes, with a leathery aspect as well.   Sweet flavor with low bitterness.   Relatively clean in the finish from a malt or hop perspective, but there was a mild metallic note that sat uneasily with me.   Full bodied and rich.   Decent, but  I just wasnt too into this.

UPDATED: NOV 12, 2009 Bottle from Crown #6. Pours Black with brown edge and quick fading brown head. Nose is faint chocolate and dark malt. Taste is....a mess. The chocolate and dark malt is still there, but its sour in a not-so-good way. Slight carbonation that doesnt help either. Just an all around odd taste that distracts from a beer that had a chance till I swallowed. 

Felt obligated to re-rate from my Draft serving at FFF (bumped it from a 2.6 to a 4.1) Poured pitch black with 1 finger tan head. Smooth and creamy dark malt and chocolate with a persistent black licorice taste that compliments nicely. Very good this time, I think I must have had a bad bottle.

UPDATED: OCT 14, 2009 Intensely dark in color with minimal, leggy head.  Aroma is fantastic with bits of smoke, coffee, licorice, and brown sugar.  Much less sweet than some other highly-regarded baltic porters.  Layers of peat, smoke, and roasted malt veil the slightest nuance of green olive.  Mouthfeel is smooth, alcohol is supremely hidden, and my only complaint is that the body is a tad thin for the richness of the flavors and aromas.  Without a doubt, this is one of the kings of the style.  Hail Finland!

24oz stein. Pours black with a nice size tan head. Long lasting lace. Aroma was rich roasted malt, brown sugar, dark fruit and chocolate. The flavor is just as rich. Roasted malt, chocolate, dark fruit, earthy flavors. A light smoked flavor to the whole thing as well. Has a good mouth feel, some light carbonation and a clean dry finish. I liked this beer. Doesnt have that metallic after taste like a lot of American Porters.

This Baltic poter is outstanding, with rich, complex flavour and texture, yet high drinkability.

Basically black, it has a very large, rich, frothy light brown head that shrinks only slowly to a permanent, thin, foamy top and rich, frothy lace.

The aroma is mild wine, chocolate, prunes, toast. Although with firm, complex elements, its somewhat subdued.

The taste is rich, complex, smooth and clean.  All flavours, sweetness and bitterness are beautifully balanced with complex taste of leaves, chocolate, dark toasted brown bread, prunes, a hint of port, some raisin, black pepper, the latter stronger in the finish, with an increasing taste of black coffee condensed with brown sugar that is stronger by the end. It is rather dry throughout, not too bitter or sweet. In the middle, it has a definite but light sweetness and light but slightly stronger bitterness right at the finish, but for most of the time, up front and in the final finish and aftertaste, it is mostly dry, clean, and leafy.

Bottle from La Bodega.. Pours brown with a mocha head.. Aroma is roasty, chocolate, coffee, beef jerky.. Flavor is very roasty with some coffee and a lingering bitterness. I think one of the brewers might have dropped a cigarette in there as well.. Not an everyday drinker for me but still pretty good.

(Bottled) Black. Medium sized, tan coloured and lighty fizzy head. Roastedness, liquorice and some coffee in aroma. Full bodied palate with medium carbonation. Roastedness, lightly ash, liquorice, some coffee and bitterness in taste. Long lasting roasty and bitter aftertaste.

Amazing porter!  The aroma is very fruity, chocolate, roasted coffee.  The appearance is a beautifule deep brown, tan head.  The flavor is like the aroma, fruity up front, with bitter chocolate an\d roasted coffee notes following behind.  The finish has a light bittering from hops, and roasted coffee flavors.  The mouithfeel is a medium to thick, smooth.  Very enjoyable beer.

Draught, on 25th July 2009, at Ginger Man NYC. Solid, impenetrably black with earthy brown head giving "swiss cheese patterning" in its lacing. Looks very handsome in the glass. Creamy lacticity and some citrus notes are met simultaneously by smoky, roasted malts which combine in a pungent kick. This is followed by a short, sharp finish containing sour and bitter notes all delivered on a smooth, but not untextured, mouthfeel. Very rewarding porter!

Draft at Pizzeria Paradiso.  Pours black with a dark brown head.  Nice aroma of roasted malt and chocolate.  Flavor is more of the same, big on the dark chocolate, with some bitter cocoa and a hint of sourness.  Heavy and creamy on the palate with a dry and bitter finish.  Very nice.

GrammercyTavern.  Deep dark black with ruby edges.  Aroma of rasted malt and cherry, reddish tan head.  Beautiful.  Raosted malt/carbon hits first, develops into  sweet fruit, sweet dark chocolate, some coffee, bit of hops in the end.  Finishes bitter and warm.

Bottle. Pours with an ultra deep brown body, and a huge, creamy brown head Tons of lace, everywhere.. Earth, raisins, dark fruit, caramel, chocolate and toasted almonds. Taste is a bit smokey, with tobacco, nuts, milk chocolate. chocolate and a distinct metallic flavor. Earthy. Finishes more than slightly lactic. Medium to thin mouthfeel, light bubbles. Starting to get an understanding for the style. The American versions are far different than their Scandinavian counterparts.

draft @ redlight redlight.  Chocolate malts, creamy vanilla, roasty malts, sweet milk chocolate on the nose.  Pours black with a thick tan head.  Smooth and creamy, with milk chocolate flavors, creamy sweet vanilla, hints of bitter chocolate and roasted malts in the flavor.  Extremely smooth and easy to drink!  Great baltic porter!

Pours black with a huge dense brown head, diminishes slightly, great lace. Nose of dark fruit, sweet malt, raisins, coffee. Taste is slight sourness, roasted malt, chocolate, moving into a semi-bitter hoppyness and finishing with a touch of alcohol. Medium-full body, creamy, soft carbonation, finishes dry. Quite balanced, the sourness is a little weird at first, but I slowly grew to like it.

11.2oz bottle. Pours a black body with a finger-width, dark brown, creamy and dense, inch thick head that dissipates quickly and leaves a moderate lacing. Aroma is buttery sweet malts, grapes, chocolate, raisin, a light sour fruit, and a bit of whiskey. Flavor is sweet as well with a wild mixture of flavors. Some blueberry cream, grapes, chocolate, vanilla, moderately bitter hops and roast, a bit figgy, and just a light coffee. Finishes dry and lingers with a fruity caramel/chocolate, medium bitterness and roast, and a creamy honey. Palate is medium bodied and clean. Overall, a really tasty baltic porter. Fruity with plenty of porter taste. Nice.

Pours black as ever with a large chunky head that resembles melted chocolate ice cream. Leaves nice lacing too. The aroma is full of roasted malts, coffee, chocolate, anise, and maybe some dark fruit. The flavor is similar except for some watery sweetness that purges through and throws off the dark bitter everything else. Finish is coffee bitter and some cloying sweetness. Good, but wouldve liked the flavors to blend better.
Tap at Ginger Man. Aroma of lots of candied fruits, some musty notes. Flavor adds sweet malt and some chocolate. Ok.
Tap at Ginger Man.  Ehh.  not very complex.  Aroma is roasted malts and some strange sours sweetness.  Flavor is roasted malt and coffee with not much else.
Pours black with a brown head. Aroma is sweet and roasty malt, dark fruit and a bit of smoke. Flavor is roasty malt, smoke, and a dry finish.

On tap at The GInger Man (listed as Sinebrychoff Porter).  Pours black with a tan head.  Aroma is sour and peaty, kind of weird.  Flavor is very medicinal with sweet roasted malt.  This was pretty bad...my opinion seems very different from other ratebeerians--bad keg?
5/4/5/3/10 (2.7/5)

12 oz bottle from secret santa. Thanks Rudy. Pours an opaque black with a large tan head that has fair retention and plenty of lacing. The aroma is strong with coffee, roasted malts and dark fruits. The taste is rich and earthy with coffee, mocha, prunes and dirt. The mouthfeel is silky smooth and dry with soft carbonation. The finish is long with lingering coffee. Overall: My first brew from Finland and a very niceone at that.

Pours oily/inky black, viscous, thick, black as black with a scanty dark tan head that laces surprisingly well. Nose is smoky, rich, and roasty. Restrained dark fruit, hut metal, salt, bitter chocolate, milk chocolate. coffee. Tastes big, rich, creamy and yet sharp, flinty, smoky, flint and gunpowder spiciness give way to spicy chocolate. Mildly oily, very ashy and more bitter as it warms. Also drops the metallic character as it warms. Killer.

Shared with savvy1982. Pours jet black with caramel highlights when held up to the light. The head is small and tan coloured. It sticks around and has nice lacing. Smells smokey, with notes of chocolate, salt, licorice, dark fruit and black pepper, Tastes flinty with smoke, salt, chocolate, dark fruit, licorice and red fruit. Palate is nice. Nice beer.

On tap at 4th Avenue pub (a couple weeks ago).  Dark brown.black with lasting head and lace.  Earthy wet forest undergrowth roasted coffee and chocolate aroma.  Earthy bitter chocolate flavor with strong fruity fig and dark fruit.  Smooth but too fruity.  Like roasted chocolate figs.

Cloudy, dark brown pour with a foamy, medium brown head, a slightly sweet plum and molasses nose, very strong, oily mouthfeel, almost fruity with a chocolately malty, cherry and almond flavor, alcoholic finish, interesting.
33cL bottle: apperance is pitch black with creamy tan head, aroma of roasted malt, flavor has lots of roasted malt and chocolate, pretty big body for a porter.

Black pour with a dark brown head. Nice roasted malt aroma. Nice roaasted malt flavor, some dryness at the end. It has a little sweetness. Alcohol is not noticeable. A very good Baltic Porter at a very decent, affordable price.Some lacing on the glass. The beer clung to the side of the glass.

Source:Guest tap at DLD. 
Glass:Cup. 
Appearance:Black body with a thin beige head.  
Aroma:Chocolate and caramel dominate. 
Flavor:Coffee and chocolate, with a dry finish. 
Palate:Full body with soft carbonation.
Overall:Excellent beer.  One that Im glad to have tried.

Pours a black body with a tan head.  Sweet creamy chocolate malt with lighter caramel and some vanilla.  Creamy body with a lighter hoppiness and a dry mineral finish.  Light coffee roast and a light warming.

Cant beat the appearance of this for my nickel.  Thick and black and tan head.  Strong aroma of prunes, coffee, soy, cough medicine and sicky sweetness, oh yeah, rock on.  Palate is a touch thin and a bit of a disappointment, roasted, nutty.  As it warms its better.  The hop and malt profiles increase nicely and the palates not so thin anymore.  Sweet and viscous as it warmed.  Oh Im liking this better and better.

poured a dark and full bodied like a stout with 1 inch thick brown head aromas of roasted malts,hops and coffee taste of soy sauce,roasted dark malts,coffee and hops overall bold with lots of lacing reminds me of a stout in body and appearence

Bottle.  Poured black with thick beige head. Much lacing.  Powerful aroma of walnuts, caramel and melt.  Flavour is complex blend of walnuts, caramel, roast malt and a hoppish edge. Rich lasting finish.  Good with the old songs.
user_location: Munchen an der Willamette, Oregon, USA

text: 330ml bottle. Had it in room temperature. Pours nearly black with a nice brownish head that also seems to last quite long. Aroma is strong roasted and quite good actually. Flavor begins sweet malty and advances to a nice, roasty finish with some coffee also. Very nice, definitely the best finnish beer Ive had so far.
From a bottle poured black with a small amount of head.  Nice strong toatsed malty flavor with a lingering finish.

Bottle 33 cl. Black with a tan head. A malt-dominated aroma with sugars present in abundance. Some roastiness in taste combines with hints of dark chocolate, coffee and raisins. Some bitterness in the finish. One of the best Finnish beers by a non-microbrewery.

Poured black with a superb and lacing, foamy and creamy beige head. Delicious aroma of coffee, roasted grains, some dried fruits and liqueric alcohol, vanilla. Rich body, oily texture with sweet coffe, deep roasted malt, dark chocolate, some creamy vanilla. Fine bitterness in the finish. Fine and delicious one, strong personality what makes numbly my tongue...

Pours nice dark tan head. Fairly foamy, but it does eventually collapse. Aroma heavy in malts and dark sugars. Dark black body with no light passing through. Not overly roasted in flavor, but bitterness does creep up in the aftertaste. Good body. Not thin, but not overly thick like some Baltics can be.

Pours a deep black with a big tan head leaving a very good lace. The aroma is very plummy with some vanilla and chocolate. The aroma doesnt smack you across the nose, youve kind of got to get youre face in the glass, but what is there is very nice indeed. The flavor is complex lots of wonderful things going on. There is a deep earthiness, with complimentary dark fruit notes of raisin and plum. There is a slight burnt toast/burnt sugar thing going on that tastes far better than it sounds. This is very robust and very roasty, with a bitterness that reminds me of espresso but its weird because there isnt much coffee in the flavor. This isnt particularly dry but its in no way cloying. The beer finishes off with a wonderful lingering lightly syrupy mouth feel. Freaking wonderful!
UPDATED: JUN 23, 2009 Bottle 33 cl. Apperance; Black with a big lightbrown head. Aroma; Sweet, dark fruits, malty and some licorice. Flavor; Medium sweet, coffee. Nice with lot of Aromas and flavors.

bottle
Pours deep dark brown, mocha head
Aroma , malty, some bitter chocolate and roasted malts
Taste was just amazing Lots of good chocolate, coffee, roasted malts with a light bitter finish
Mouthfeel leans more toward cocoa with some charcoal palate, dry finish

Bottle many thanks from mreusch.  Pours a very dark brown, almost black.  Very malty, caramel, dark chocolate, smoke, raisins, molasses, and hints of coffee.  Roasty with some saltiness.  I enjoyed it.  Thanks Matt.

Cask and handpump at the Plough & Harrow in Hammersmith. Black-brown with beige head, lots of liquorice  on the nose and palate, sharp bitter finish, but the body is oddly dry and slightly salty - echoes of salt lakrids! A bit thinner than I expected and dry rather than creamy. Reminds me of a beery Black Pig or North Sea Oil...

330 ml bottle. Finland.
Dark brown colour with big fluffy tan head.
Roasted malts, dark chocolate and dried fruits in aroma. Rich flavour is roasted malts, coffee. Very dry and warming (without taste of alcohol). Excellent.

Brown with ruby lowlights and a large tan creamy head that slowly disappears and leaves some spotty lacing in its wake.  Aroma of chocolate, molasses, raison, cocoa, roasted and dark malts.  Taste of chocolate, roasted malt, cocoa, molasses and raison.  Beer has a nice full mouth feel but finishes up coating the tongue with a residue that reminds me of artificial sweetener, not so pleasant.  Theres some warming on the back end.

Full pint pour, draft at Birreria Paradiso in DC.  Opaque black-brown with a tan orange head.  Sweet and malty, sort of middle of the road.  Sugary with touch of roastiness, its not unlike other standard Baltic Porters.
Bottle shared with Steve and Eric.  Pours dark brown with a thick tan head.  Rick malty flavor on the palate and finish of choc hops.

Very dark, with a fine brown head that lasts really good. Aroma: roasted, liquorice, dark chocolate and maybe some tar also (a very finnish thing, tar). Taste: roasted, coffe, tar, salt, very dry. Rich mouthfeel. Not very sweet. Really good one.

My first Finnish brew.  Typical label.  Dark pour with huge, fluffy tan head, and lace on the glass.  The aroma is fruity with an unfortunate touch of skank.  The taste is very impressive.  The rich, dry coffee flavor is abetted by a full dose of hops.  The bottle I had might have been a tiny bit off, but I could tell that this is a good porter.
Bottle- Black with tan foam head.  Bitter roast with malts and a tart anise-licorice flavor.  Good body and blend, a decent mellow porter.

Pours dark brown nearly black with a nice thick creamy tan head. Aroma of sweet malted chocolate, a bit candy like with some toffee and hints of clove. Nicely pleasant but a little too overly sweet and simple. Flavor starts with a mellow licorice sweetness that gains a nice chocolate creaminess. Gets just a bit of a smoked woody flavor in the back of the mouth and finishes very smooth and creamy. Excellent mouth feel and surprisingly refreshing for a heavier alcohol. Nice mellow carbonation and and not overly sticky. Very good all around.
Bottle at Jacobs - Southern Lord Day. Black - brown head. Burned, berries, chocolate, oxidation, high malty, bitterness, light hoppy, coffee, sweetness. OK.
Draught: Poured a deep oily black with light head. Aroma is roasted malts, coffee, and light hops. Taste is sweet roasted malts and coffee.
